text_1_html: In December , a landmark study by the national institutes on treatment of the disorder found that the drug Ritalin was more effective than behavioral - modification therapy , which is what is primarily used in Britain .
text_2_html: " One of the key questions in the evaluation is has the child always had difficulty sitting still , sustaining attention to a task , or is this something new , " said Gold , who added that often behavioral and other educational help is tried first before approaching medication .
text_1: In December, a landmark study by the national institutes on treatment of the disorder found that the drug Ritalin was more effective than behavioral-modification therapy, which is what is primarily used in Britain.
prev_text_1: In 1998 a panel of experts commissioned by the National Institutes of Health found that a consistent diagnostic method for the disorder had proved elusive.
text_2: "One of the key questions in the evaluation is has the child always had difficulty sitting still, sustaining attention to a task, or is this something new," said Gold, who added that often behavioral and other educational help is tried first before approaching medication.
prev_text_2: Severe marital stress or financial stress in the household can affect the child, and other psychiatric problems can overlap or mimic ADHD, such as severe anxiety.

text_1_html: A recent US Geological Survey report cited the UN 's prediction that sea ice off Alaska will probably shrink to nearly half the area it covered in 1980 , with profound effects on mammals dependent on sea ice .
text_2_html: Shrinkage of sea ice continues apace .
text_1: A recent US Geological Survey report cited the UN's prediction that sea ice off Alaska will probably shrink to nearly half the area it covered in 1980, with profound effects on mammals dependent on sea ice.
prev_text_1: An Interior Department report edited out language in studies mentioning global warming as the cause of the polar bears' plight.
text_2: Shrinkage of sea ice continues apace.
prev_text_2: Business groups fear listing would impose costs and delays by creating a requirement to limit greenhouse gases.

text_1_html: Under a Pentagon directive, bans on cell phone use while driving are becoming common on military bases.
text_2_html: The Defense Department approved restrictions on cell phone use by motorists but left it for the military services and individual bases to decide how to enforce it .

text_1_html: On March 1st , Major General Weightman , Chief of Walter Reed , was fired by Army Secretary Harvey because the army had lost trust and confidence in him .
text_2_html: Army Secretary Francis Harvey , who dismissed Walter Reed commander General George Weightman the previous Thursday , has resigned himself .

text_2: Army Secretary Francis Harvey, who dismissed Walter Reed commander General George Weightman the previous Thursday, has resigned himself.

text_1_html: On October 2 , 2006 , a gunman , Charles Roberts , entered an Amish school near Lancaster , PA , took the children hostage , killed five girls and wounded seven other children before killing himself .
text_2_html: Monday morning , October 2 , Charles Carl Roberts IV , 32 , armed with a handgun and shotgun , laid siege to the one - room West Nickel Mines Amish School in Lancaster County , PA .

text_1_html: The politicians are among 59 people held hostage by the FARC , including 22 politicians , 34 military personnel and police officers and three US nationals .
text_2_html: The trio remain in captivity despite a five - million - dollar US reward for information leading to their release and an August offer from Colombian President Alvaro Uribe to swap 50 imprisoned rebels for their freedom along with that of 22 politicians and 34 soldiers and police officers held by the FARC .
text_1: The politicians are among 59 people held hostage by the FARC, including 22 politicians, 34 military personnel and police officers and three US nationals.
text_2: The trio remain in captivity despite a five-million-dollar US reward for information leading to their release and an August offer from Colombian President Alvaro Uribe to swap 50 imprisoned rebels for their freedom along with that of 22 politicians and 34 soldiers and police officers held by the FARC.

text_1_html: Yushchenko won a repeat runoff on December 26 and took office in January , his face still disfigured by the poison .
text_2_html: In a third round of voting on 26 December , Yushchenko won 51.99 % of the vote to Yanukovich 's 44.20 % .
text_1: Yushchenko won a repeat runoff on December 26 and took office in January, his face still disfigured by the poison.
prev_text_1: The Ukraine Supreme Court overturned the November runoff election results due to fraud, and Parliament enacted new anti-fraud election reforms in December.

text_1: Yushchenko won a repeat runoff on December 26 and took office in January, his face still disfigured by the poison.

text_1_html: Colombia 's hardline government said Friday it is willing to meet with members of the country 's main leftist rebel group in an unprecedented offer aimed at freeing dozens of rebel hostages , including three Americans .
text_2_html: The trio remain in captivity despite a five - million - dollar US reward for information leading to their release and an August offer from Colombian President Alvaro Uribe to swap 50 imprisoned rebels for their freedom along with that of 22 politicians and 34 soldiers and police officers held by the FARC .

text_1_html: Prosecutors are asking for prison sentence of 38,656 years but Spanish law only allows no more than 40 years .
text_2_html: On 6 November prosecutors sought jail terms exceeding 38,000 years for each of 7 leading suspects.
text_1: Prosecutors are asking for prison sentence of 38,656 years but Spanish law only allows no more than 40 years.
prev_text_1: The second accused, Youssef Belhadj said he would only respond through his lawyer.

text_1_html: Almost two - thirds of traditional U.S. medical schools now teach alternative therapies , including chiropractic , acupuncture , herbal remedies and mind - body medicine , a survey found .
text_2_html: One study found that moxibustion , a traditional Chinese therapy in which a herb , Artemisia vulgaris , was burned next to an acupuncture point on the toe , proved safe and effective for stimulating fetuses in the wombs of pregnant women to turn over from a breech position to a head - first position , which is safer for delivery .
text_1: Almost two-thirds of traditional U.S. medical schools now teach alternative therapies, including chiropractic, acupuncture, herbal remedies and mind-body medicine, a survey found.
text_2: One study found that moxibustion, a traditional Chinese therapy in which a herb, Artemisia vulgaris, was burned next to an acupuncture point on the toe, proved safe and effective for stimulating fetuses in the wombs of pregnant women to turn over from a breech position to a head-first position, which is safer for delivery.
prev_text_2: Among the fastest growing therapies were herbal remedies, massage, megavitamins, relaxation techniques and "spiritual healing."

text_1_html: Eight Dover families are suing the school district , alleging that the policy violates the constitutional separation of church and state .
text_2_html: The organization and the US National Center for Science Education issued a statement , supporting students ' parents to sue the Dover school district , Pennsylvania , against its decision to include " intelligent design , " which says life has a God - like creator , in the curriculum of ninth - grade biology classes .

text_1_html: Kempthorne added his department is not taking a position on why the ice is melting ; that 's beyond the scope of the Endangered Species Act .
text_2_html: The administration has prohibited its scientists , when acting as government representatives , from linking human factors to polar bears and global warming .
text_1: Kempthorne added his department is not taking a position on why the ice is melting; that's beyond the scope of the Endangered Species Act.
prev_text_1: On December 27, 2006, U.S. Interior Secretary, Dirk Kempthorne, announced a proposal to list the polar bear as a threatened species because of sea ice loss.
text_2: The administration has prohibited its scientists, when acting as government representatives, from linking human factors to polar bears and global warming.
prev_text_2: The designation prohibits federal agencies from authorizing anything, including oil drilling, that would harm the bears' habitat.

text_1_html: Scientists from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology said the fault line that ruptured in Turkey Tuesday , producing a devastating earthquake , had been identified more than two years ago as a particularly dangerous one .
text_2_html: The death toll from the powerful earthquake in Turkey has risen to 7,085 , with 33,559 injured , the government crisis center said early Friday , two days after the quake hit the northwestern part of the country .

text_1_html: Many primary - care physicians are unaware of aggressive treatment strategies that go beyond medications , the Arthritis Foundation found , despite research showing the value of support groups , exercise classes and other complementary therapies .
text_2_html: Exercise - especially gentle and progressive resistance exercise that strengthens leg muscles - is getting increased attention among arthritis researchers .
text_1: Many primary-care physicians are unaware of aggressive treatment strategies that go beyond medications, the Arthritis Foundation found, despite research showing the value of support groups, exercise classes and other complementary therapies.
prev_text_1: "There are tips that physical therapists can offer to help people with arthritis to avoid fatigue and flare-ups and to make their homes more arthritis-friendly," said APTA president Jan K. Richardson.
text_2: Exercise - especially gentle and progressive resistance exercise that strengthens leg muscles - is getting increased attention among arthritis researchers.
prev_text_2: Framingham data show that a weight loss of 11 pounds in women of medium height reduced the risk of painful knee arthritis by half.

text_1_html: One of two exhausted balloonists trying to become the first to circle the globe nonstop sobbed with joy and relief Friday when he was told they have enough fuel to reach the finish line in Africa .
text_2_html: The Breitling ground team in Geneva forecast that the huge Swiss - registered balloon would complete its circuit of the Earth on Saturday , somewhere in North Africa .
text_1: One of two exhausted balloonists trying to become the first to circle the globe nonstop sobbed with joy and relief Friday when he was told they have enough fuel to reach the finish line in Africa.
text_2: The Breitling ground team in Geneva forecast that the huge Swiss-registered balloon would complete its circuit of the Earth on Saturday, somewhere in North Africa.
prev_text_2: The prospect that the Breitling's crew, Bertrand Piccard and Brian Jones, may succeed where all others have failed seemed more promising with each passing hour.

text_1_html: The Romanian banking system is ready to perform services in the European single currency , the euro , the Rompres news agency reported on Tuesday citing sources from Romania 's Central Bank .
text_2_html: BNR indicative exchange rates will be modified to include euro instead of the current European single currency , the ECU .
text_1: The Romanian banking system is ready to perform services in the European single currency, the euro, the Rompres news agency reported on Tuesday citing sources from Romania's Central Bank.
text_2: BNR indicative exchange rates will be modified to include euro instead of the current European single currency, the ECU.
prev_text_2: BNR and Romanian commercial banks that want to perform euro services will have to open accounts in euro by January 4, 1999, the first scheduled day of euro use, and inform their foreign partners.

text_2: In the northwest in Xinjiang about $2.46 billion will be invested to stop the desert from expanding.
prev_text_2: Farmers are encouraged to grow compost crops instead of leaving land fallow.

text_1_html: WASHINGTON ( AP ) -- The government should set up a nationwide network of fitting stations for child seats to help save children 's lives in car crashes , the National Transportation Safety Board recommended Wednesday .
text_2_html: The company 's move follows a recommendation by the National Transportation Safety Board in January that a nationwide network of " fitting stations " for child seats be established to prevent the deaths of children in automobile accidents .
text_1: WASHINGTON (AP) -- The government should set up a nationwide network of fitting stations for child seats to help save children's lives in car crashes, the National Transportation Safety Board recommended Wednesday.
text_2: The company's move follows a recommendation by the National Transportation Safety Board in January that a nationwide network of "fitting stations" for child seats be established to prevent the deaths of children in automobile accidents.
prev_text_2: Also involved is the child seat manufacturer Fisher-Price and the nonprofit National Safety Council.

text_1_html: Spain 's largest bank , Santander , believes it may have lost over $ 3 billion .
text_2_html: Among those duped were top US investors , large European banks , and a Tokyo bank .
text_1: Spain's largest bank, Santander, believes it may have lost over $3 billion.
prev_text_1: Banks and financial authorities across Europe were urgently trying to determine the scope and impact of losses.
text_2: Among those duped were top US investors, large European banks, and a Tokyo bank.
prev_text_2: For decades Madoff appeared to be remarkably successful, but when investors requested the return of about $7 billion in principal at the end of 2007, Madoff confessed his business was a giant Ponzi scheme.

text_1_html: Johanna Dwyer of NIH cautioned that the public should not assume that vitamin D is a magic bullet and consume high amounts .
text_2_html: The study cautioned that the issue is far from settled and advised people not to assume vitamin D is a cure - all and consume large doses .
text_1: Johanna Dwyer of NIH cautioned that the public should not assume that vitamin D is a magic bullet and consume high amounts.
prev_text_1: One exception noted was that people with more vitamin D had a significantly lower risk of death from colorectal cancer.
text_2: The study cautioned that the issue is far from settled and advised people not to assume vitamin D is a cure-all and consume large doses.
prev_text_2: It found no sign that vitamin D lowered the overall risk of dying from cancer except for significantly lowering the risk of death from colorectal cancer.

text_1_html: The rapid retreat of Greenland glaciers suggest that climate change is a factor , Hamilton said .
text_2_html: Two of Greenland 's largest glaciers are retreating at an alarming pace , most likely because of climate warming , scientists said Wednesday .

text_1_html: The Frankfurt - based body said in its annual report released today that it has decided on two themes for the new currency : history of European civilization and abstract or concrete paintings .
text_2_html: The institute requires the design of the Euro to include five languages of the European Union together with the symbol of the EU -- 12 stars in a ring .
text_1: The Frankfurt-based body said in its annual report released today that it has decided on two themes for the new currency: history of European civilization and abstract or concrete paintings.
prev_text_1: The European Monetary Institute, responsible for the preparations, has set up a consultative group of artists, art historians and psychologists to come up with designs.
text_2: The institute requires the design of the Euro to include five languages of the European Union together with the symbol of the EU -- 12 stars in a ring.
prev_text_2: The institute, which functions as a preparatory European Central Bank, began to invite tenders for making the new currency in February.

text_1_html: The rapid breakdown of the floating ice shelves observed in recent years , the experts said , could destabilize land - based ice sheets and glaciers behind them and cause faster melting and rise in sea levels than anticipated .
text_2_html: US and European scientists fear the collapse of ice shelves in Greenland and Antarctica will raise ocean levels faster than estimated , said a report published Friday in the journal Science .
text_1: The rapid breakdown of the floating ice shelves observed in recent years, the experts said, could destabilize land-based ice sheets and glaciers behind them and cause faster melting and rise in sea levels than anticipated.
text_2: US and European scientists fear the collapse of ice shelves in Greenland and Antarctica will raise ocean levels faster than estimated, said a report published Friday in the journal Science.

text_1_html: Roswell Gilbert shot his wife Emily , who suffered Alzheimer 's and osteoporosis .
text_2_html: Active mercy killings include Philip Lee Saylor who shot his AIDS - suffering friend Steven Charles Jenkins ; Roswell Gilbert who shot his Alzheimer - suffering wife Emily ; a man who shot his fatally lion - mauled friend ; British doctor Alan Cox who gave an elderly patient a heart - stopping injection ; Delbert Ward who suffocated his ill brother William in his sleep ; and three Austrian nurses and West German nurse Michaela Roeder who gave patients lethal injections .

text_1_html: But with the rise of online bookselling and instant purchases at the click of a computer mouse , book clubs in the late 1990s were forced to offer something more than discounts .
text_2_html: Independent booksellers , which have fought a two - decades war against chains and , more recently , online booksellers , are seeking to gain ground on the Internet with two large - scale Web sites .
text_1: But with the rise of online bookselling and instant purchases at the click of a computer mouse, book clubs in the late 1990s were forced to offer something more than discounts.
prev_text_1: For readers living far from a bookstore, the system offered a convenient alternative.
text_2: Independent booksellers, which have fought a two-decades war against chains and, more recently, online booksellers, are seeking to gain ground on the Internet with two large-scale Web sites.
prev_text_2: Telewest Communications, Britain's second-biggest cable company, is in talks to acquire about 10 percent of Chello Broadband, a unit of United Pan-Europe Communications.

text_1_html: With the agreement , Newt and Marianne Gingrich end a tense legal standoff and avoid a potentially embarrassing public divorce trial .
text_2_html: Cobb County Judge Dorothy Robinson made the Gingriches ' divorce final and agreed to seal the agreement , which they signed early this week .
text_1: With the agreement, Newt and Marianne Gingrich end a tense legal standoff and avoid a potentially embarrassing public divorce trial.
prev_text_1: A court-appointed mediator who spent 12 hours negotiating a settlement agreement between the Gingriches filed her report Friday, saying the couple came to a "full settlement" early that morning.
text_2: Cobb County Judge Dorothy Robinson made the Gingriches' divorce final and agreed to seal the agreement, which they signed early this week.
prev_text_2: On Thursday, accusations of wrongdoing and the mining of dirt in the former U.S. House speaker's divorce case gave way to a secret settlement between Gingrich and his wife of 18 years, Marianne Gingrich.

text_1_html: " We want a policy to say that local , state and federal responders should actively assist animal rescue , " he said .

text_1_html: Chinese lead - painted toys are responsible for major recalls by U.S. toy makers .
text_2_html: Recently , RC2 Corp. recalled 1.5 million wooden Thomas & Friends trains and accessories , and Mattel recalled nearly 1 million of its Fisher - Price toy characters , all Chinese - manufactured toys found to contain excessive amounts of lead in their paint .
text_1: Chinese lead-painted toys are responsible for major recalls by U.S. toy makers.
text_2: Recently, RC2 Corp. recalled 1.5 million wooden Thomas & Friends trains and accessories, and Mattel recalled nearly 1 million of its Fisher-Price toy characters, all Chinese-manufactured toys found to contain excessive amounts of lead in their paint.
prev_text_2: Recalled toys include a toy found to be filled with kerosene, an infant rattle that was a choking hazard and toy drums sets and bears recalled for lead paint.

text_1_html: But authors of the study -- which involved 212 boys , including 75 with attention - deficit hyperactivity disorder , or ADHD -- said the findings should help allay concerns that giving children potentially addictive drugs such as Ritalin may promote harmful habits later .

text_1_html: At least 600 people have been confirmed dead and thousands of others injured in the 6.7-degree earthquake which ripped through western Turkey at 3:00 am ( 0000 GMT ) .
text_2_html: The death toll from the powerful earthquake in Turkey has risen to 7,085 , with 33,559 injured , the government crisis center said early Friday , two days after the quake hit the northwestern part of the country .

text_1_html: Many primary - care physicians are unaware of aggressive treatment strategies that go beyond medications , the Arthritis Foundation found , despite research showing the value of support groups , exercise classes and other complementary therapies .
text_2_html: A Tufts University study presented at the Boston rheumatology meeting showed a home exercise regimen improved leg strength by 71 percent and reduced arthritic knee pain by 36 percent .
text_1: Many primary-care physicians are unaware of aggressive treatment strategies that go beyond medications, the Arthritis Foundation found, despite research showing the value of support groups, exercise classes and other complementary therapies.
prev_text_1: "There are tips that physical therapists can offer to help people with arthritis to avoid fatigue and flare-ups and to make their homes more arthritis-friendly," said APTA president Jan K. Richardson.
text_2: A Tufts University study presented at the Boston rheumatology meeting showed a home exercise regimen improved leg strength by 71 percent and reduced arthritic knee pain by 36 percent.

text_1_html: With the agreement , Newt and Marianne Gingrich end a tense legal standoff and avoid a potentially embarrassing public divorce trial .
text_2_html: On Thursday , accusations of wrongdoing and the mining of dirt in the former U.S. House speaker 's divorce case gave way to a secret settlement between Gingrich and his wife of 18 years , Marianne Gingrich .
text_1: With the agreement, Newt and Marianne Gingrich end a tense legal standoff and avoid a potentially embarrassing public divorce trial.
prev_text_1: A court-appointed mediator who spent 12 hours negotiating a settlement agreement between the Gingriches filed her report Friday, saying the couple came to a "full settlement" early that morning.
text_2: On Thursday, accusations of wrongdoing and the mining of dirt in the former U.S. House speaker's divorce case gave way to a secret settlement between Gingrich and his wife of 18 years, Marianne Gingrich.
prev_text_2: Newt Gingrich is a bachelor again.

text_1_html: Scientists from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology said the fault line that ruptured in Turkey Tuesday , producing a devastating earthquake , had been identified more than two years ago as a particularly dangerous one .
text_2_html: At least 600 people have been confirmed dead and thousands of others injured in the 6.7-degree earthquake which ripped through western Turkey at 3:00 am ( 0000 GMT ) .
text_1: Scientists from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology said the fault line that ruptured in Turkey Tuesday, producing a devastating earthquake, had been identified more than two years ago as a particularly dangerous one.

text_1_html: In June , 2007 , toy maker RC2 Corp. recalled 1.5 million Thomas & Friends toys that were decorated with lead paint , which can cause long - term neurological damage .
text_2_html: Recently , RC2 Corp. recalled 1.5 million wooden Thomas & Friends trains and accessories , and Mattel recalled nearly 1 million of its Fisher - Price toy characters , all Chinese - manufactured toys found to contain excessive amounts of lead in their paint .
text_1: In June, 2007, toy maker RC2 Corp. recalled 1.5 million Thomas & Friends toys that were decorated with lead paint, which can cause long-term neurological damage.
text_2: Recently, RC2 Corp. recalled 1.5 million wooden Thomas & Friends trains and accessories, and Mattel recalled nearly 1 million of its Fisher-Price toy characters, all Chinese-manufactured toys found to contain excessive amounts of lead in their paint.
prev_text_2: Recalled toys include a toy found to be filled with kerosene, an infant rattle that was a choking hazard and toy drums sets and bears recalled for lead paint.

text_1_html: WASHINGTON ( AP ) -- The government should set up a nationwide network of fitting stations for child seats to help save children 's lives in car crashes , the National Transportation Safety Board recommended Wednesday .
text_2_html: Another safety agency , the National Transportation Safety Board , called attention to the problem of wrongly installed seats , urging creation of a network of permanent " fitting stations " for child seats that the government , automakers and private safety agencies would operate jointly .

text_1_html: To expand markets abroad in the early 1990s , American tobacco companies took advantage of weak advertising restrictions , trade barrier removal , and state tobacco monopoly liberalization , in China , Soviet Union , Japan , Eastern Europe , South Korea , France , Italy , Spain , Turkey , Thailand , Taiwan , and Portugal .
text_2_html: They formed or joined multi - national conglomerates and pursued international tobacco markets as communism fell and monopolies were relaxed .

text_1_html: The program succeeded in lowering the growth rate from 2.4 percent to 2.1 percent in the first half of 1994 .
text_2_html: Yet , the serious economic disadvantages to nations and individuals of over - population have driven Islamic Iran , Egypt , Albania , Tunisia ( which abolished polygamy ) , and largely Catholic Spain , Italy , Mexico , Brazil and other Latin American countries to remove government subsidies encouraging large families , start family planning ( particularly contraception ) ; women 's health and education ; and women 's emancipation and employment efforts , to reduce fertility rates , as have the U.K. , Germany , India , China , Mauritius , the Philippines , Zimbabwe and Botswana .
text_1: The program succeeded in lowering the growth rate from 2.4 percent to 2.1 percent in the first half of 1994.
prev_text_1: In 1994, the Philippines instituted an aggressive population program that promoted the use of contraceptives.
text_2: Yet, the serious economic disadvantages to nations and individuals of over-population have driven Islamic Iran, Egypt, Albania, Tunisia (which abolished polygamy), and largely Catholic Spain, Italy, Mexico, Brazil and other Latin American countries to remove government subsidies encouraging large families, start family planning (particularly contraception); women's health and education; and women's emancipation and employment efforts, to reduce fertility rates, as have the U.K., Germany, India, China, Mauritius, the Philippines, Zimbabwe and Botswana.
prev_text_2: Conversely, in 1977 labor-strapped Singapore, births declined 12% during the astrologically inauspicious "year of the snake".

text_1: The program succeeded in lowering the growth rate from 2.4 percent to 2.1 percent in the first half of 1994.

text_2: Yet, the serious economic disadvantages to nations and individuals of over-population have driven Islamic Iran, Egypt, Albania, Tunisia (which abolished polygamy), and largely Catholic Spain, Italy, Mexico, Brazil and other Latin American countries to remove government subsidies encouraging large families, start family planning (particularly contraception); women's health and education; and women's emancipation and employment efforts, to reduce fertility rates, as have the U.K., Germany, India, China, Mauritius, the Philippines, Zimbabwe and Botswana.
prev_text_2: Conversely, in 1977 labor-strapped Singapore, births declined 12% during the astrologically inauspicious "year of the snake".

text_1_html: Colombia 's hardline government said Friday it is willing to meet with members of the country 's main leftist rebel group in an unprecedented offer aimed at freeing dozens of rebel hostages , including three Americans .
text_2_html: The politicians are among 59 people held hostage by the FARC , including 22 politicians , 34 military personnel and police officers and three US nationals .

text_1_html: A third and final withdrawal from all of the West Bank would take place before a final peace agreement set for May 4 , 1999 .
text_2_html: According to the Oslo accords , a permanent peace agreement should be signed between the Palestinians and Israel by the date .
text_1: A third and final withdrawal from all of the West Bank would take place before a final peace agreement set for May 4, 1999.
prev_text_1: A second phase of Israeli withdrawal from the West Bank was to be completed by September 1997.
text_2: According to the Oslo accords, a permanent peace agreement should be signed between the Palestinians and Israel by the date.
prev_text_2: The students held a demonstration on the occation of May 4, the date on which the five-year Palestinian interim self-rule period, stipulated in the Oslo accords, expires, to demand an early end of Israeli occupation of the Palestinian land and the declaration of an independent Palestinian state in the territories.

text_1_html: Active mercy killings include Philip Lee Saylor who shot his AIDS - suffering friend Steven Charles Jenkins ; Roswell Gilbert who shot his Alzheimer - suffering wife Emily ; a man who shot his fatally lion - mauled friend ; British doctor Alan Cox who gave an elderly patient a heart - stopping injection ; Delbert Ward who suffocated his ill brother William in his sleep ; and three Austrian nurses and West German nurse Michaela Roeder who gave patients lethal injections .
text_2_html: Husbands kill wives , e.g. cancer victim Virginia Harper was suffocated and Emily Gilbert , Alzheimer 's sufferer , was shot .
text_1: Active mercy killings include Philip Lee Saylor who shot his AIDS-suffering friend Steven Charles Jenkins; Roswell Gilbert who shot his Alzheimer-suffering wife Emily; a man who shot his fatally lion-mauled friend; British doctor Alan Cox who gave an elderly patient a heart-stopping injection; Delbert Ward who suffocated his ill brother William in his sleep; and three Austrian nurses and West German nurse Michaela Roeder who gave patients lethal injections.
prev_text_1: Routinely, doctors, patients or relatives decide whether potentially life-prolonging treatments should be started, stopped, or continued.
text_2: Husbands kill wives, e.g. cancer victim Virginia Harper was suffocated and Emily Gilbert, Alzheimer's sufferer, was shot.

text_1_html: Extractive reserves have been formed for managed harvesting of timber , rubber , Brazil nuts , and medicinal plants without deforestation .
text_2_html: Brazilian programs to reduce deforestation and CO2 emission , and promote sustainable development include " extractive reserves " which globally market renewable " rain - forest chic " products ( replenishable trees , produce , nuts , latex , pharmaceutical plants ) ; discontinuing subsidies to clear - cutting for unsustainable ranches which dislocated forest people ; tree improvement ; pesticide controls ; minimizing roads and mineral mining impacts ; increasing fish pond farming ; and improving law enforcement .
text_1: Extractive reserves have been formed for managed harvesting of timber, rubber, Brazil nuts, and medicinal plants without deforestation.
prev_text_1: Natural preserves have been created.
text_2: Brazilian programs to reduce deforestation and CO2 emission, and promote sustainable development include "extractive reserves" which globally market renewable "rain-forest chic" products (replenishable trees, produce, nuts, latex, pharmaceutical plants); discontinuing subsidies to clear-cutting for unsustainable ranches which dislocated forest people; tree improvement; pesticide controls; minimizing roads and mineral mining impacts; increasing fish pond farming; and improving law enforcement.
prev_text_2: A $139bn Eximbank funded system of radar; airplanes; ground and satellite sensors; and communications networks monitors Brazil's Amazon for environmental research, border control, and drug interdiction.

text_1_html: Croatia and Hungary are considering a pipeline to bring liquid gas from North Africa and the Middle East .
text_2_html: The project , which seeks to address recent disruptions in Russian gas supplies to Europe , calls for building a liquiefied petroleum gas ( LPG ) terminal at an Adriatic port and transporting the gas to central Europe .

text_1_html: The two together appeared to reduce knee pain after 8 weeks .
text_2_html: His conclusion , outlined in an article earlier this year in the Journal of the American Medical Association , was that the overseas clinical trials do show that glucosamine and chondroitin reduce pain in osteoarthritis sufferers and are safe .

text_1_html: Independent booksellers , after a two - decade war against chains and online booksellers , are seeking to gain ground in a number of ways , including appeals to the FTC .
text_2_html: But with the rise of online bookselling and instant purchases at the click of a computer mouse , book clubs in the late 1990s were forced to offer something more than discounts .
text_1: Independent booksellers, after a two-decade war against chains and online booksellers, are seeking to gain ground in a number of ways, including appeals to the FTC.
prev_text_1: Adults purchased over 50 million titles online and that number is expected to increase significantly in the next year.
text_2: But with the rise of online bookselling and instant purchases at the click of a computer mouse, book clubs in the late 1990s were forced to offer something more than discounts.
prev_text_2: For readers living far from a bookstore, the system offered a convenient alternative.

text_1_html: U.S. officials have made no secret of their concern that Syrian intelligence officers may still be in Lebanon .
text_2_html: The United States and the Lebanese opposition leader Walid Jumblatt have alleged that Syria is continuing to maintain intelligence agents in Lebanon , despite its withdrawal of troops from Lebanon in April .

text_1_html: Mini - mills make steel by melting scrap metal in small electric arc furnaces , avoiding the expensive process of making pig iron and reducing the number of manufacturing steps .
text_2_html: The new technology , called thin - slab casting , sharply cuts the time and capital costs required for steel sheet production , namely by melting scrap iron rather then pig iron , then casting the steel into two - inch slabs , and rolling them into coils , all in a single production run .
text_1: Mini-mills make steel by melting scrap metal in small electric arc furnaces, avoiding the expensive process of making pig iron and reducing the number of manufacturing steps.
prev_text_1: The new technology for the manufacture of steel takes place in "mini-mills".
text_2: The new technology, called thin-slab casting, sharply cuts the time and capital costs required for steel sheet production, namely by melting scrap iron rather then pig iron, then casting the steel into two-inch slabs, and rolling them into coils, all in a single production run.
prev_text_2: A new revolutionary steel production technology in "mini-mills" in smaller steel production companies in the US is yielding impressive profits and snatching from Big Steel much of the lower end US steel products market.

text_1_html: Wetlands in the Pinelands and throughout the state are supposed to be off limits to development because of their value as a wildlife habitat and a water cleansing system .
text_2_html: These areas play important roles in filtering and cleansing water , in serving as a reservoir for flood water , and in harboring fish and shellfish populations .
text_1: Wetlands in the Pinelands and throughout the state are supposed to be off limits to development because of their value as a wildlife habitat and a water cleansing system.
prev_text_1: Under the permit created in April, the 47 cranberry growers in the Pinelands would be entitled to expand bogs to a collective maximum of 300 acres of wetlands over the next five years.
text_2: These areas play important roles in filtering and cleansing water, in serving as a reservoir for flood water, and in harboring fish and shellfish populations.
prev_text_2: The term "wetlands" is generally used to describe marshes, swamps, bogs and similar areas typically situated between dry land and bodies of water.

text_1_html: Obama , whose father was from Kenya and mother was from Kansas , rose to national prominence after delivering a keynote address at the Democratic National Convention this July .

text_1_html: What Furman was treating himself for , he found out , was a psychiatric condition most often associated with children - attention deficit hyperactivity disorder .
text_2_html: ADHD is a neurological and genetic disorder that , Barkley said , is the most widely inherited trait of any psychiatric disorder .
text_1: What Furman was treating himself for, he found out, was a psychiatric condition most often associated with children - attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.
prev_text_1: "I was self-medicating and I didn't know it."
text_2: ADHD is a neurological and genetic disorder that, Barkley said, is the most widely inherited trait of any psychiatric disorder.
prev_text_2: ADHD has only within the last few years been recognized as a legitimate adult diagnosis.

text_1_html: U.S. officials said Thursday Washington was certain that Syrian military intelligence operatives remain in Lebanon in defiance of international demands to withdraw all forces and agents .
text_2_html: U.S. officials have made no secret of their concern that Syrian intelligence officers may still be in Lebanon .

text_1_html: In August , China issued a circular requiring all officials who had invested in coal mines to retract stakes .
text_2_html: 836 officials and state - owned enterprise ( SOE ) leaders have abandoned their coal mine investments in north China 's Shanxi province , a major coal producing region , amid a nationwide crackdown on illegal coal mine investment by officials .

text_1_html: His conclusion , outlined in an article earlier this year in the Journal of the American Medical Association , was that the overseas clinical trials do show that glucosamine and chondroitin reduce pain in osteoarthritis sufferers and are safe .
text_2_html: The largest of its kind , published this month in the journal Osteoarthritis and Cartilage , looked at how glucosamine - chondroitin affected pain and movement in 93 patients with arthritic knees .

prev_text_1: Studies show that glucosamine relieves osteoarthritis pain as well as ibuprofen, without the side effects, and that chondroitin stops joint degeneration, improves joint function, and eases pain.
text_2: The largest of its kind, published this month in the journal Osteoarthritis and Cartilage, looked at how glucosamine-chondroitin affected pain and movement in 93 patients with arthritic knees.
prev_text_2: A series of US studies is trying to weed out those quality problems and come up with definitive answers.

text_1_html: Independent booksellers , after a two - decade war against chains and online booksellers , are seeking to gain ground in a number of ways , including appeals to the FTC .

text_1_html: An official Syrian newspaper on Saturday dismissed as " lies " American allegations that Syria still maintained troops or intelligence officials in Lebanon following their full withdrawal in April .
text_2_html: The United States and the Lebanese opposition leader Walid Jumblatt have alleged that Syria is continuing to maintain intelligence agents in Lebanon , despite its withdrawal of troops from Lebanon in April .

text_1_html: A onetime congressional staffer who became a top partner to lobbyist Jack Abramoff pleaded guilty to conspiring to bribe a congressman and other public officials and agreed to pay back more than $ 19 million he fraudulently charged Indian tribal clients .
text_2_html: WASHINGTON - Former high - powered lobbyist Jack Abramoff , a longtime associate of top Republican leaders , pleaded guilty Tuesday to conspiracy , fraud and tax evasion and agreed to cooperate with federal officials investigating political corruption in the nation 's capital .

text_1_html: Wetlands in the Pinelands and throughout the state are supposed to be off limits to development because of their value as a wildlife habitat and a water cleansing system .
text_2_html: The wetlands are necessary for water conservation , flood prevention , adjusting weather and maintaining the varieties of organisms .
text_1: Wetlands in the Pinelands and throughout the state are supposed to be off limits to development because of their value as a wildlife habitat and a water cleansing system.
prev_text_1: Under the permit created in April, the 47 cranberry growers in the Pinelands would be entitled to expand bogs to a collective maximum of 300 acres of wetlands over the next five years.
text_2: The wetlands are necessary for water conservation, flood prevention, adjusting weather and maintaining the varieties of organisms.
prev_text_2: Wetlands, an important natural ecological system known as the earth's "kidney" include marshland, lakes, rivers and other shallow water land.

text_1_html: The failure of the ATPC to enforce production quotas , increased production by non- ATPC members such as China and Brazil as well as the entry of new producers Peru , Portugal , and Vietnam , and the US Defense Logistics Agency disposing of large amounts of tin , all served to undermine the tin industry in Southeast Asia .
text_2_html: By 1993 China and Brazil were major tin producers and , as non - members of the ATCP , were stockpiling and exporting vast amounts of tin , driving the price down .
text_1: The failure of the ATPC to enforce production quotas, increased production by non- ATPC members such as China and Brazil as well as the entry of new producers Peru, Portugal, and Vietnam, and the US Defense Logistics Agency disposing of large amounts of tin, all served to undermine the tin industry in Southeast Asia.
prev_text_1: The Malayan Mining Employers' Association which groups Malaysia's mining and smelting companies considered disbanding because of the decline of the industry in that country.
text_2: By 1993 China and Brazil were major tin producers and, as non-members of the ATCP, were stockpiling and exporting vast amounts of tin, driving the price down.
prev_text_2: Also glass, aluminum, and plastic began replacing tin as containers and the tin coating on tin-plated steel cans became thinner.

text_1_html: The emancipation of women , along with state - controlled family programs and the increasing use of contraceptives in Tunisia and Egypt , has cut the population growth rate in those countries nearly in half .
text_2_html: Women being educated , working , and using contraception have slowed Tunisia 's rate , while Singapore 's dropped too sharply for the government .
text_1: The emancipation of women, along with state-controlled family programs and the increasing use of contraceptives in Tunisia and Egypt, has cut the population growth rate in those countries nearly in half.
prev_text_1: The growth rate in American is about 1 percent a year, 0.5 percent in Russia, and 0.3 percent in Western Europe.
text_2: Women being educated, working, and using contraception have slowed Tunisia's rate, while Singapore's dropped too sharply for the government.
prev_text_2: The policy in China is to limit couples to one child through financial incentives and aggressively promoting contraception.

text_1_html: Czechoslovakia 's split up was the result of growing deep - rooted Slovak nationalism following the collapse of the Soviet bloc .
text_2_html: In the two years after the collapse of communism in Prague , the Czech and Slovak republics were unable to agree on a political basis for future coexistence in one country .
text_1: Czechoslovakia's split up was the result of growing deep-rooted Slovak nationalism following the collapse of the Soviet bloc.
text_2: In the two years after the collapse of communism in Prague, the Czech and Slovak republics were unable to agree on a political basis for future coexistence in one country.

text_1_html: In December 1994 , Tony Blair , Labour leader , and probable prime minister after an upcoming election , signaled a constitutional battle with the Tories by setting out proposals for devolution for Scotland and Wales .
text_2_html: Tony Blair , the Labor party leader , planned to pursue his intentions to set up a Welsh assembly .
text_1: In December 1994, Tony Blair, Labour leader, and probable prime minister after an upcoming election, signaled a constitutional battle with the Tories by setting out proposals for devolution for Scotland and Wales.
prev_text_1: The British Labour party had long supported demands by Scotland and Wales for independent assemblies.
text_2: Tony Blair, the Labor party leader, planned to pursue his intentions to set up a Welsh assembly.
prev_text_2: On December 31, 1994 a fight was expected to begin on the devolution of parliamentary powers to Wales.

text_1_html: Indian tribes on reservations enjoy a unique legal status .
text_2_html: Privileges of tribal sovereignty include unique hunting and fishing rights , and the ability to sell gas and cigarettes tax - free , set zooming , and ban or sell alcohol .

text_2: Privileges of tribal sovereignty include unique hunting and fishing rights, and the ability to sell gas and cigarettes tax-free, set zooming, and ban or sell alcohol.

text_1_html: Problems facing Indians and the reservation system include decreased funding for Indian programs ; repeal of affirmative action laws ; Indian culture and local regulations conflicting with federal or state laws , tribes not being fully recognized and having no access to federal funds ; and banks unwilling to give Indians home loans that are backed by land held in trust .
text_2_html: The nature of the land -- " held in trust " -- effectively shuts the Indians out of conventional home loan processes .
text_1: Problems facing Indians and the reservation system include decreased funding for Indian programs; repeal of affirmative action laws; Indian culture and local regulations conflicting with federal or state laws, tribes not being fully recognized and having no access to federal funds; and banks unwilling to give Indians home loans that are backed by land held in trust.
prev_text_1: Tribal authorities deal with minor crimes but turn to federal help for more serious crime.
text_2: The nature of the land -- "held in trust" -- effectively shuts the Indians out of conventional home loan processes.
prev_text_2: There is poor health care and higher than average death rates from alcohol, diabetes, suicide, and accidents.

text_1_html: The tobacco industry initially has responded with intense advertising , lobbying in Washington , and using cash flow from tobacco operations to finance diversification into food industries .
text_2_html: Two U.S. tobacco companies , Phillip Morris and RJ Reynolds , used aggressive , long - term strategies , beyond export sales , to capture new international tobacco markets which privatization had expanded from 60 % closed to 95 % open .
text_1: The tobacco industry initially has responded with intense advertising, lobbying in Washington, and using cash flow from tobacco operations to finance diversification into food industries.
prev_text_1: This effort is in reaction to a domestic outbreak of hostility from politicians, government officials, business, and the public in efforts to curb tobacco consumption by stringent anti-smoking measures.
text_2: Philip Morris advertised intensely and invested heavily to increase production and crops worldwide.
prev_text_2: International sales and company profits increased steadily.

text_1_html: The flight recorder was recovered on November 9 and revealed that the autopilot was disconnected , the descent appeared " controlled , " the cockpit turned off both engines , and the elevators were out of unison .
text_2_html: Data from one Black Box showed that both engines had been switched off from the cabin and that the elevators , which raise or lower the plane 's nose were in an uneven setting , a move not believed possible for the crew to make .
text_1: The flight recorder was recovered on November 9 and revealed that the autopilot was disconnected, the descent appeared "controlled," the cockpit turned off both engines, and the elevators were out of unison.
prev_text_1: Initial speculation centered on a thrust reverser (deactivated in Cairo).
text_2: Data from one Black Box showed that both engines had been switched off from the cabin and that the elevators, which raise or lower the plane's nose were in an uneven setting, a move not believed possible for the crew to make.
prev_text_2: Neither pilot nor co-pilot sent a distress message.

text_1_html: Prices for tin fell dramatically and tin mining operations , particularly those involved in high cost hard rock mining , were forced to close down or cut back operation .
text_2_html: Factors leading to tin mining decline include : depleted high - grade tin reserves and high production costs outside Indonesia , Vietnam , China , Brazil , Bolivia , Peru , and Portugal ; labor shortages and rising wages ; Russia becoming a net tin exporter ; tin market arbitrage ; a strong Malaysian currency against the U.S. dollar ; glass , aluminum and plastic packaging ; thinner tin coatings on steel cans ; and decreased tin - lead solder use .
text_1: Prices for tin fell dramatically and tin mining operations, particularly those involved in high cost hard rock mining, were forced to close down or cut back operation.
prev_text_1: Beginning in 1985 too much tin had been stockpiled in many countries in the world and was released on the market.
text_2: Factors leading to tin mining decline include: depleted high-grade tin reserves and high production costs outside Indonesia, Vietnam, China, Brazil, Bolivia, Peru, and Portugal; labor shortages and rising wages; Russia becoming a net tin exporter; tin market arbitrage; a strong Malaysian currency against the U.S. dollar; glass, aluminum and plastic packaging; thinner tin coatings on steel cans; and decreased tin-lead solder use.
prev_text_2: The U.S. continued selling its "substantial" tin stockpiles, while U.K. warehouses brimmed with tin.

prev_text_1: A city administrator pleaded guilty to mail fraud in a scheme that bilked investors out of $3 million, a crime which carries a maximum sentence of five years in prison, but a US District judge gave him only five years probation and ordered $20,000 in restitution.
text_2: In 1989 Lyndon LaRouche drew a 15-year sentence, while Barry Minkow got 25 years and a $25 million restitution order.
prev_text_2: In 1986 a crooked investment banker got only 2 years in jail and an insider trader got 3 years.

text_1_html: This process must be conducted internationally , because US , Japanese and European authorities often require different clinical trials .
text_2_html: Profitable drugs are sold worldwide so trials must be conducted in the US , Europe , and Japan .
text_1: This process must be conducted internationally, because US, Japanese and European authorities often require different clinical trials.
prev_text_1: These typically involve three phases, an average of 200 patients per trial, and are the longest, most costly stages in new drug development.
text_2: Profitable drugs are sold worldwide so trials must be conducted in the US, Europe, and Japan.
prev_text_2: This is done with pre-clinical trials, then with clinical trials on humans.

text_1_html: In France , art dealers are obliged by law to register all purchases except those bought at public auction .
text_2_html: In France dealers must register all purchased art , except what is bought at auction .
text_1: In France, art dealers are obliged by law to register all purchases except those bought at public auction.
prev_text_1: In Great Britain, the International Art Loss Registry founded by the leading auction houses (Sotheby's, Christie's and Phillips) has a computerized data bases easily accessed by law enforcement authorities and insurance companies.
text_2: In France dealers must register all purchased art, except what is bought at auction.
prev_text_2: Stolen art has been recovered when offered to police sting operations or to legitimate buyers or dealers, who detect that the offered art is stolen through catalogs of stolen items circulated among dealers, auction houses, museums and police or by their consulting the International Art Loss Register, to which any one, not just major art holders, can report thefts.

text_1_html: The Slovaks had long been resentful of the Czech - dominated federal government and the two parts of the country could not agree on a political basis for their existence as a single country .
text_2_html: In the two years after the collapse of communism in Prague , the Czech and Slovak republics were unable to agree on a political basis for future coexistence in one country .
text_1: The Slovaks had long been resentful of the Czech-dominated federal government and the two parts of the country could not agree on a political basis for their existence as a single country.
prev_text_1: The Czechs voted for rapid market reforms and integration into Europe under the leadership of Vaclav Klaus and the Slovaks voted for the party of Vladimir Meciar and its avowedly separatist agenda.
text_2: In the two years after the collapse of communism in Prague, the Czech and Slovak republics were unable to agree on a political basis for future coexistence in one country.

text_2_html: This area includes not only the Amazon itself in Brazil , but the headwaters rising in Venezuela , Colombia , Ecuador , Peru and Bolivia .

text_1_html: The Czechs voted for rapid market reforms and integration into Europe under the leadership of Vaclav Klaus and the Slovaks voted for the party of Vladimir Meciar and its avowedly separatist agenda .
text_2_html: In June 1992 Czech politicians who wanted a rapid market reform and integration into the rest of Europe were elected , while the elected Slovaks were members of the nationalist - populist and separatist parties and were calling for greater autonomy .
text_1: The Czechs voted for rapid market reforms and integration into Europe under the leadership of Vaclav Klaus and the Slovaks voted for the party of Vladimir Meciar and its avowedly separatist agenda.

text_2: In June 1992 Czech politicians who wanted a rapid market reform and integration into the rest of Europe were elected, while the elected Slovaks were members of the nationalist-populist and separatist parties and were calling for greater autonomy.

text_1_html: This process must be conducted internationally , because US , Japanese and European authorities often require different clinical trials .

text_2: A federal judge sentenced political extremist Lyndon H. LaRouche, Jr. to 15 years in prison on mail and tax fraud convictions.

text_1_html: In addition , states are enacting graduated licensing laws to limit new drivers until they gain experience .
text_2_html: New Mexico in 1999 attacked automobile safety with a graduated licensing law requiring a learner 's permit followed by an intermediate license , both with restrictions on night driving and number of young passengers aboard , and finally a full license if the driver has a clear record .
text_1: In addition, states are enacting graduated licensing laws to limit new drivers until they gain experience.
prev_text_1: Anti-lock brakes, computerized stability and traction control, all-wheel drive, low-tire-pressure detectors, reverse sensing systems, better suspension and handling, and blue-tint headlights all contribute to this end.
text_2: New Mexico in 1999 attacked automobile safety with a graduated licensing law requiring a learner's permit followed by an intermediate license, both with restrictions on night driving and number of young passengers aboard, and finally a full license if the driver has a clear record.
prev_text_2: Several electronic computer-controlled devices were produced to warn of or compensate for dangerous driving conditions, and record data on vehicle performance ("black box").

text_1_html: The flight recorder was recovered on November 9 and revealed that the autopilot was disconnected , the descent appeared " controlled , " the cockpit turned off both engines , and the elevators were out of unison .
text_2_html: Both engines had been switched off from the cockpit , something experienced pilots would not do .
text_1: The flight recorder was recovered on November 9 and revealed that the autopilot was disconnected, the descent appeared "controlled," the cockpit turned off both engines, and the elevators were out of unison.
prev_text_1: Initial speculation centered on a thrust reverser (deactivated in Cairo).
text_2: Both engines had been switched off from the cockpit, something experienced pilots would not do.
prev_text_2: EgyptAir said this was its best crew, but there were strange operational events.

text_1_html: By 1999 he had monitored more than 20 elections in 16 countries including Nicaragua , Liberia , Nigeria , Venezuela , China ( village and township committee elections ) , Indonesia , Mozambique , Peru , the Dominican Republic and Mexico .
text_2_html: He had monitored more than 20 elections in 16 countries .
text_1: By 1999 he had monitored more than 20 elections in 16 countries including Nicaragua, Liberia, Nigeria, Venezuela, China (village and township committee elections), Indonesia, Mozambique, Peru, the Dominican Republic and Mexico.
prev_text_1: Working in conjunction with the Carter Center that he founded and the National Democratic Institute of International Affairs, Carter has led many international teams of observers to monitor elections throughout the world.
text_2: He had monitored more than 20 elections in 16 countries.
prev_text_2: By mid-1999, Carter had visited 115 countries on missions to promote peace and human rights or to combat disease and hunger.

text_1_html: To face competition from online marketing , the ABA has created its own online store for independent booksellers , Book Sense .
text_2_html: To meet online competition , the ABA opened Book Sense and Contentville , online selling and commentary sites serving as hubs for individual stores .
text_1: To face competition from online marketing, the ABA has created its own online store for independent booksellers, Book Sense.
prev_text_1: The FTC concluded that the planned merger violated antitrust law and recommended that the commission step in to block it.
text_2: To meet online competition, the ABA opened Book Sense and Contentville, online selling and commentary sites serving as hubs for individual stores.
prev_text_2: It censured author Frank McCourt for participating in chainstore advertising, challenged barnesandnoble.com's claim "If we don't have your book nobody does," led successful opposition to B&N's plan to purchase the largest book distributor (threatening independents with reduced service and compromised records), and joined the Northern California Independent Booksellers Association in urging collection of taxes from on-line bookstores.

text_1_html: Examples of AI charges include the following : Israel has been accused of using torture in interrogating Palestinians ; Nigeria , of contempt for human rights ; Germany , of police racism ; Russia , of continuing human rights violations including torture of prisoners and use of the death penalty ; Brazil , of holding an unfair trial for an activist ; Kosovo , of war crimes ; Sri Lanka , of illegal detention camps ; Indonesia , of torturing pro - democracy activists ; Britain , of selling arms to countries such as Indonesia and Algeria ; the U.S. , of having the death penalty ; and South Korea , of trying to control an independent human rights commission .
text_2_html: Specific criticisms AI has lodged are that German police are racist ; that a leader of Brazil 's landless movement did not receive a fair trial ; and that the international community allowed Cambodia 's political killings and intimidation through its " near silence " .
text_1: Examples of AI charges include the following: Israel has been accused of using torture in interrogating Palestinians; Nigeria, of contempt for human rights; Germany, of police racism; Russia, of continuing human rights violations including torture of prisoners and use of the death penalty; Brazil, of holding an unfair trial for an activist; Kosovo, of war crimes; Sri Lanka, of illegal detention camps; Indonesia, of torturing pro-democracy activists; Britain, of selling arms to countries such as Indonesia and Algeria; the U.S., of having the death penalty; and South Korea, of trying to control an independent human rights commission.
prev_text_1: The usual reaction to such charges is denial.
text_2: Specific criticisms AI has lodged are that German police are racist; that a leader of Brazil's landless movement did not receive a fair trial; and that the international community allowed Cambodia's political killings and intimidation through its "near silence".

text_1_html: Examples of AI charges include the following : Israel has been accused of using torture in interrogating Palestinians ; Nigeria , of contempt for human rights ; Germany , of police racism ; Russia , of continuing human rights violations including torture of prisoners and use of the death penalty ; Brazil , of holding an unfair trial for an activist ; Kosovo , of war crimes ; Sri Lanka , of illegal detention camps ; Indonesia , of torturing pro - democracy activists ; Britain , of selling arms to countries such as Indonesia and Algeria ; the U.S. , of having the death penalty ; and South Korea , of trying to control an independent human rights commission .
text_2_html: Specific criticisms AI has lodged are that German police are racist ; that a leader of Brazil 's landless movement did not receive a fair trial ; and that the international community allowed Cambodia 's political killings and intimidation through its " near silence " .

text_1_html: Data from one Black Box showed that both engines had been switched off from the cabin and that the elevators , which raise or lower the plane 's nose were in an uneven setting , a move not believed possible for the crew to make .
text_2_html: Both engines had been switched off from the cockpit , something experienced pilots would not do .
text_1: Data from one Black Box showed that both engines had been switched off from the cabin and that the elevators, which raise or lower the plane's nose were in an uneven setting, a move not believed possible for the crew to make.
prev_text_1: Neither pilot nor co-pilot sent a distress message.
text_2: Both engines had been switched off from the cockpit, something experienced pilots would not do.
prev_text_2: EgyptAir said this was its best crew, but there were strange operational events.

text_1_html: Nuclear reactors powering the ship were taken off line and no radiation leaks detected .
text_2_html: The ship was reported not to be carrying nuclear weapons and its nuclear reactor had been switched off .
text_1: Nuclear reactors powering the ship were taken off line and no radiation leaks detected.
prev_text_1: Possible causes of the accident were a collision (favored Russian explanation, perhaps as the Kursk rose to periscope level), an onboard explosion (most likely explanation, probably involving a torpedo and triggering further detonations), or hitting a WWII mine.
text_2: The ship was reported not to be carrying nuclear weapons and its nuclear reactor had been switched off.
prev_text_2: Initial reports indicated that the ship may have been involved in a collision or could have been damaged by an explosion.

text_1_html: El Nino may lessen global warming by temporarily stemming the release of carbon dioxide from the Pacific .
text_2_html: It may also help cut global warming by temporarily stemming release of carbon dioxide from the Pacific Ocean .
text_1: El Nino may lessen global warming by temporarily stemming the release of carbon dioxide from the Pacific.
prev_text_1: Its effects on mortality and the economy are mixed.
text_2: It may also help cut global warming by temporarily stemming release of carbon dioxide from the Pacific Ocean.
prev_text_2: On the positive side, El Nino can be credited with saving lives that would have been lost in normal winter and hurricane seasons.

text_1_html: La Nina alternates with El Nino and is fueled by abnormally cold water in the eastern Pacific .

text_1: Russia exports more adopted children, mostly to the U.S., than any other country, and is the world's largest supplier of Caucasian adoptees.

text_2: Russia has replaced China as the nation providing most children for adoption in the US and those two countries have been amending their laws to prevent abuses in adoptions.

text_1_html: The Thailand office of AI gave a human rights award to three publications and two journalists in 1998 .
text_2_html: On a more positive note , three Thai publications and two Thai journalists won the 1998 AI Journalism Award for Human Rights .
text_1: The Thailand office of AI gave a human rights award to three publications and two journalists in 1998.
prev_text_1: It has also provided legal assistance in some cases.
text_2: On a more positive note, three Thai publications and two Thai journalists won the 1998 AI Journalism Award for Human Rights.
prev_text_2: Examples of AI charges include the following: Israel has been accused of using torture in interrogating Palestinians; Nigeria, of contempt for human rights; Germany, of police racism; Russia, of continuing human rights violations including torture of prisoners and use of the death penalty; Brazil, of holding an unfair trial for an activist; Kosovo, of war crimes; Sri Lanka, of illegal detention camps; Indonesia, of torturing pro-democracy activists; Britain, of selling arms to countries such as Indonesia and Algeria; the U.S., of having the death penalty; and South Korea, of trying to control an independent human rights commission.

prev_text_1: The first Russian rescue attempts did not begin until Aug 15.

text_1_html: La Nina alternates with El Nino and is fueled by abnormally cold water in the eastern Pacific .
text_2_html: La Nina is the phenomenon of rapidly cooling equatorial waters in the central Pacific .
text_1: La Nina alternates with El Nino and is fueled by abnormally cold water in the eastern Pacific.
prev_text_1: El Nino may lessen global warming by temporarily stemming the release of carbon dioxide from the Pacific.
text_2: La Nina is the phenomenon of rapidly cooling equatorial waters in the central Pacific.
prev_text_2: It also helps trigger some man-made disasters, such as forest fires, and enhances conditions that cause viral disease among humans and livestock.

text_1_html: Schools keep all but main doors locked , require visitor passes , and some have installed panic alarms .
text_2_html: These preventive measures included posting armed security officers in schools ; using metal detectors and surveillance cameras , conducting searches for weapons in schools ; tightening access to campuses and improving screening for school visitors ; locking most school entrances during the school day ; installing a hot line and tip box for reporting incidents that might lead to violence ; expelling students who bring a gun to school ; requiring school uniforms ; making it harder to conceal a weapon by requiring transparent book bags and forbidding baggy clothing .
text_1: Schools keep all but main doors locked, require visitor passes, and some have installed panic alarms.
prev_text_1: Physical building security measures include removing lockers, on-campus armed guards, metal detectors, gun- and bomb-sniffing dogs, and video surveillance.
text_2: These preventive measures included posting armed security officers in schools; using metal detectors and surveillance cameras, conducting searches for weapons in schools; tightening access to campuses and improving screening for school visitors; locking most school entrances during the school day; installing a hot line and tip box for reporting incidents that might lead to violence; expelling students who bring a gun to school; requiring school uniforms; making it harder to conceal a weapon by requiring transparent book bags and forbidding baggy clothing.
prev_text_2: A series of well-publicized school shooting in Colorado, Mississippi, Kentucky, Arkansas, and Oregon caused schools and school districts to take measures to prevent school violence and shootings.

text_1_html: Most children came from Russia , China , and Korea .
text_2_html: Russia and China , the primary sources for adoption by Americans , have recently passed laws that put tighter restrictions on the procedures for adoption .
text_1: Most children came from Russia, China, and Korea.
prev_text_1: In 1999, 16,396 adopted children came to the US from abroad.
text_2: Russia and China, the primary sources for adoption by Americans, have recently passed laws that put tighter restrictions on the procedures for adoption.
prev_text_2: In July 2000, the US ratified the Hague Convention on Intercountry Adoption, which was created to establish guidelines for international adoptions, harmonize the practices of different countries, improve the treatment of children, and curtail corruption, fraud and smuggling in the process.

text_1_html: Examples of AI charges include the following : Israel has been accused of using torture in interrogating Palestinians ; Nigeria , of contempt for human rights ; Germany , of police racism ; Russia , of continuing human rights violations including torture of prisoners and use of the death penalty ; Brazil , of holding an unfair trial for an activist ; Kosovo , of war crimes ; Sri Lanka , of illegal detention camps ; Indonesia , of torturing pro - democracy activists ; Britain , of selling arms to countries such as Indonesia and Algeria ; the U.S. , of having the death penalty ; and South Korea , of trying to control an independent human rights commission .
text_2_html: AI charges of racist acts by the German police were thoroughly investigated by German state officials in what they termed an impartial review that found that the police were not racist as a whole .

text_1_html: La Nina is the phenomenon of rapidly cooling equatorial waters in the central Pacific .
text_2_html: There is abnormal cooling of the Pacific sea surface creating a colder , stronger jet stream in the upper atmosphere .
text_1: La Nina is the phenomenon of rapidly cooling equatorial waters in the central Pacific.
prev_text_1: It also helps trigger some man-made disasters, such as forest fires, and enhances conditions that cause viral disease among humans and livestock.
text_2: There is abnormal cooling of the Pacific sea surface creating a colder, stronger jet stream in the upper atmosphere.
prev_text_2: La Nina is the opposite condition.

text_1_html: These preventive measures included posting armed security officers in schools ; using metal detectors and surveillance cameras , conducting searches for weapons in schools ; tightening access to campuses and improving screening for school visitors ; locking most school entrances during the school day ; installing a hot line and tip box for reporting incidents that might lead to violence ; expelling students who bring a gun to school ; requiring school uniforms ; making it harder to conceal a weapon by requiring transparent book bags and forbidding baggy clothing .
text_2_html: Some of these measures are modifications or additions to the school 's physical plant such as installing metal detectors and surveillance cameras , keeping most doors locked , removing lockers that could be used to store weaponry , removing things that could provide concealment for a sniper .

text_1_html: California sellers urged that state to collect taxes on major online retailers such as Amazon .
text_2_html: It censured author Frank McCourt for participating in chainstore advertising , challenged barnesandnoble.com 's claim " If we do n't have your book nobody does , " led successful opposition to B&N 's plan to purchase the largest book distributor ( threatening independents with reduced service and compromised records ) , and joined the Northern California Independent Booksellers Association in urging collection of taxes from on - line bookstores .
text_1: California sellers urged that state to collect taxes on major online retailers such as Amazon.
prev_text_1: The ABA also challenged the Barnes & Noble's advertising claim, "If we don't have your book, nobody does," as misleading, asking for the claim to be discontinued.
text_2: It censured author Frank McCourt for participating in chainstore advertising, challenged barnesandnoble.com's claim "If we don't have your book nobody does," led successful opposition to B&N's plan to purchase the largest book distributor (threatening independents with reduced service and compromised records), and joined the Northern California Independent Booksellers Association in urging collection of taxes from on-line bookstores.
prev_text_2: The ABA brought antitrust suits against top publishing houses and Borders and Barnes & Noble for making secret deals that undercut independents, resulting in a $25 million payment by publishers to booksellers.

text_1_html: A clinic associated with the University of Tennessee claims a test involving monitoring the front region of the brain is 90 % effective in diagnosis .
text_2_html: Also in 2000 , a biological test was developed that monitored activity in the front region of the brain , proving 90 % effective in diagnosis .
text_1: A clinic associated with the University of Tennessee claims a test involving monitoring the front region of the brain is 90% effective in diagnosis.
prev_text_1: ADD/ADHD is diagnosed through behavioral patterns but many of those afflicted have been found to have a high concentration of a key brain protein, a dopamine transporter, which could lead to a clinical diagnosis.
text_2: Also in 2000, a biological test was developed that monitored activity in the front region of the brain, proving 90% effective in diagnosis.
prev_text_2: In 2000, for the first time the American Academy of Pediatrics set specific guidelines for diagnosis of ADHD.

text_1_html: Online book sales captured 2 % of the market in 1999 and were projected to rise to 10 % by 2002 and 18 % by 2003 .
text_2_html: Independent bookstores have been seriously damaged by superstore chains and also have been set back by increasing online sales .
text_1: Online book sales captured 2% of the market in 1999 and were projected to rise to 10% by 2002 and 18% by 2003.
prev_text_1: To meet online competition, the ABA opened Book Sense and Contentville, online selling and commentary sites serving as hubs for individual stores.
text_2: Independent bookstores have been seriously damaged by superstore chains and also have been set back by increasing online sales.
prev_text_2: Independent bookstores' market sales dropped from 16.6 percent to 15.2 percent in 1999.

text_1_html: During La Nina , which typically lasts at least a year , dry conditions take hold of South America , Africa has alternate periods of drought and flooding and rains return to Asia .
text_2_html: The current La Nina has persisted for nearly a year .
text_1: During La Nina, which typically lasts at least a year, dry conditions take hold of South America, Africa has alternate periods of drought and flooding and rains return to Asia.
prev_text_1: La Nina, Spanish for "little girl," is just the opposite, with the warm conditions of El Nino returning to the west.
text_2: The current La Nina has persisted for nearly a year.
prev_text_2: At least 41 people have died in Oklahoma alone as the result of the severe weather.

text_1_html: Turks nationwide are struggling to recover from the massive , 7.4-magnitude earthquake that struck the country 's industrial heartland early Tuesday .
text_2_html: The social and economic costs appear to be staggering .
text_1: Turks nationwide are struggling to recover from the massive, 7.4-magnitude earthquake that struck the country's industrial heartland early Tuesday.

text_2: The social and economic costs appear to be staggering.

text_1_html: The settlement closes five months of bitter legal wrangling in the case , culminating with Gingrich 's admission last month that he 's had a romantic relationship with a Washington congressional aide for six years .
text_2_html: The tentative agreement , which the Gingriches have kept private , ended what had become a bitter divorce process for Gingrich and his wife of 18 years .
text_1: The settlement closes five months of bitter legal wrangling in the case, culminating with Gingrich's admission last month that he's had a romantic relationship with a Washington congressional aide for six years.
prev_text_1: "I think both parties worked very hard."
text_2: The tentative agreement, which the Gingriches have kept private, ended what had become a bitter divorce process for Gingrich and his wife of 18 years.
prev_text_2: The Gingriches agreed to settle their divorce Dec. 16, 1999, during a court-ordered mediation session that lasted 12 hours and ended well after midnight.

text_1_html: As thousands of animals remain stranded in hurricane - ravaged Louisiana , trapped in homes or roaming evacuated streets , the head of the Humane Society complained Friday that authorities have ignored pleas to set a policy for animal rescues .
text_2_html: The Humane Society appealed for Louisiana state authorities and federal officials to intervene to ensure that any animals abandoned as residents fled New Orleans more than two weeks ago are rounded up and sent to rescue centres .
text_1: As thousands of animals remain stranded in hurricane-ravaged Louisiana, trapped in homes or roaming evacuated streets, the head of the Humane Society complained Friday that authorities have ignored pleas to set a policy for animal rescues.
text_2: The Humane Society appealed for Louisiana state authorities and federal officials to intervene to ensure that any animals abandoned as residents fled New Orleans more than two weeks ago are rounded up and sent to rescue centres.
prev_text_2: He said that troops were authorised to destroy dogs that were found to be interfering with human bodies left on the streets as floodwaters from Hurricane Katrina receded.
