text_1_html: Newt Gingrich and Marianne Gingrich spent Thursday afternoon with a mediator in their first attempt to resolve their bitter divorce .
text_2_html: A sedate Marianne Gingrich , who did attend the hearing , had only this to say about the often bitter eight - month - long divorce process : " It 's been a difficult period of time . "

text_1_html: Turkey today welcomed a statement by the European Union ( EU ) , which confirmed the perspective of Turkey 's full membership to the group .
text_2_html: The relations between Turkey and EU have been soured after EU leaders decided last December not to accept Turkey as an official new member candidate , though they did not rule out its candidacy in the future .

text_2: The relations between Turkey and EU have been soured after EU leaders decided last December not to accept Turkey as an official new member candidate, though they did not rule out its candidacy in the future.
prev_text_2: Despite the EU membership dispute with Turkey, Kinkel stressed Germany wanted to strengthen relations with the country in all areas.

text_1_html: Basketball legend Earvin " Magic " Johnson and Starbucks boss Howard Schultz brought their inner - city road show to Seattle 's Columbia City neighborhood Friday .
text_2_html: Schultz 's Seattle - based Starbucks Coffee Co. and Johnson 's Los Angeles - based Johnson Development Corp. have recently opened similar Starbucks coffee stores in West Los Angeles and New York 's Harlem .
text_1: Basketball legend Earvin "Magic" Johnson and Starbucks boss Howard Schultz brought their inner-city road show to Seattle's Columbia City neighborhood Friday.
text_2: Schultz's Seattle-based Starbucks Coffee Co. and Johnson's Los Angeles-based Johnson Development Corp. have recently opened similar Starbucks coffee stores in West Los Angeles and New York's Harlem.
prev_text_2: They opened the latest in their 50-50 joint-venture Starbucks Coffee stores and Johnson said there will be more in Seattle, along with one of Johnson's multiplex movie theaters.

text_2: Schultz's Seattle-based Starbucks Coffee Co. and Johnson's Los Angeles-based Johnson Development Corp. have recently opened similar Starbucks coffee stores in West Los Angeles and New York's Harlem.
prev_text_2: They opened the latest in their 50-50 joint-venture Starbucks Coffee stores and Johnson said there will be more in Seattle, along with one of Johnson's multiplex movie theaters.

text_2_html: A sedate Marianne Gingrich , who did attend the hearing , had only this to say about the often bitter eight - month - long divorce process : " It 's been a difficult period of time . "
text_1: The tentative agreement, which the Gingriches have kept private, ended what had become a bitter divorce process for Gingrich and his wife of 18 years.
prev_text_1: The Gingriches agreed to settle their divorce Dec. 16, 1999, during a court-ordered mediation session that lasted 12 hours and ended well after midnight.
text_2: A sedate Marianne Gingrich, who did attend the hearing, had only this to say about the often bitter eight-month-long divorce process: "It's been a difficult period of time."
prev_text_2: "It's over," said Tom Browning, an attorney for Newt Gingrich, who was not present at Thursday's hearing.

text_1_html: Researchers have suggested using " black boxes " in cars like those used in aircraft to record data pertinent to an auto crash to lead to safety improvements .
text_2_html: Finally the installation and analysis of " black boxes " that record data in the last seconds before a crash will allow engineers to better understand crashes and the causes of injuries .
text_1: Researchers have suggested using "black boxes" in cars like those used in aircraft to record data pertinent to an auto crash to lead to safety improvements.
prev_text_1: Crash tests, including tests with dummies in the rear seats provide valuable information for safety planners.
text_2: Finally the installation and analysis of "black boxes" that record data in the last seconds before a crash will allow engineers to better understand crashes and the causes of injuries.
prev_text_2: In addition, states are enacting graduated licensing laws to limit new drivers until they gain experience.

text_1_html: May 18 - After the settlement negotiations fail , the Justice Department and 20 states file a broad antitrust suit against Microsoft .
text_2_html: Local press reports said that attorneys for the Justice Department and the 19 states that successfully sued Microsoft for antitrust violations are considering ways to break up the company as a method to curb anticompetitive practices.
text_1: May 18 - After the settlement negotiations fail, the Justice Department and 20 states file a broad antitrust suit against Microsoft.
prev_text_1: May 14 - Microsoft and the Justice Department reveal that they are conducting settlement talks aimed at heading off a wide-ranging antitrust action.
text_2: Local press reports said that attorneys for the Justice Department and the 19 states that successfully sued Microsoft for antitrust violations are considering ways to break up the company as a method to curb anticompetitive practices.
prev_text_2: Antitrust lawyers from the U.S. Justice Department were summoned to the White House Tuesday to brief President Bill Clinton's legal and economic advisers about a range of options for dealing with Microsoft Corp., including splitting up the software giant.

text_1_html: A first attempt by the Russian navy to dock a rescue capsule to the sunken submarine failed in the heavy storms with 12-foot waves lashing the Barents Sea near Norway .
text_2_html: Russian rescue submarines had made four unsuccessful attempts to dock with the Kursk overnight .
text_1: A first attempt by the Russian navy to dock a rescue capsule to the sunken submarine failed in the heavy storms with 12-foot waves lashing the Barents Sea near Norway.
text_2: Russian rescue submarines had made four unsuccessful attempts to dock with the Kursk overnight.
prev_text_2: Commander Alan Hoskins, who is organizing the British effort at the scene, said they would continue offering assistance until the Russians told them to stop.

text_1_html: --Aug . 19 -- Attempts to dock with escape hatch fail again .
text_2_html: All previous attempts to dock a rescue capsule to the sub have failed and a seventh attempt was under way early Friday , the Interfax news agency reported , quoting Russian Northern Fleet spokesman Igor Babenko .

prev_text_1: Government says huge explosion shattered Kursk, but uncertain as to what triggered it.

text_1_html: The existing law stipulates that people seeking to adopt must be childless , and can only adopt one orphaned or handicapped child .
text_2_html: In a report submitted to the 4th meeting of the 9th NPC Standing Committee last Monday , Doje Cering , minister of civil affairs , said that the draft has stricter requirements on adoption of Chinese children by foreigners , but Wan pointed out today that " requirements " means adoption procedures .
text_1: The existing law stipulates that people seeking to adopt must be childless, and can only adopt one orphaned or handicapped child.
prev_text_1: "Welfare institutions are less than ideal places to promote the healthy growth of unfortunate children because of poor living conditions and the lack of family warm," said the minister.
text_2: In a report submitted to the 4th meeting of the 9th NPC Standing Committee last Monday, Doje Cering, minister of civil affairs, said that the draft has stricter requirements on adoption of Chinese children by foreigners, but Wan pointed out today that "requirements" means adoption procedures.
prev_text_2: A draft of the Adoption Law has relaxed restrictions in many aspects for Chinese and foreigners who apply for adoptions, according to a member of the National People's Congress (NPC) Standing Committee, Wan Shaofen, who was debating the draft.

text_1_html: The settlement closes five months of bitter legal wrangling in the case , culminating with Gingrich 's admission last month that he 's had a romantic relationship with a Washington congressional aide for six years .
text_2_html: A sedate Marianne Gingrich , who did attend the hearing , had only this to say about the often bitter eight - month - long divorce process : " It 's been a difficult period of time . "
text_1: The settlement closes five months of bitter legal wrangling in the case, culminating with Gingrich's admission last month that he's had a romantic relationship with a Washington congressional aide for six years.
prev_text_1: "I think both parties worked very hard."
text_2: A sedate Marianne Gingrich, who did attend the hearing, had only this to say about the often bitter eight-month-long divorce process: "It's been a difficult period of time."
prev_text_2: "It's over," said Tom Browning, an attorney for Newt Gingrich, who was not present at Thursday's hearing.

text_1_html: A judge ruled Thursday that a congressional aide linked romantically with former House Speaker Newt Gingrich must testify in his divorce case .
text_2_html: Marianne Gingrich also wants to depose Callista Bisek , a congressional aide with whom the former U.S. House speaker has a relationship .
text_1: A judge ruled Thursday that a congressional aide linked romantically with former House Speaker Newt Gingrich must testify in his divorce case.
text_2: Marianne Gingrich also wants to depose Callista Bisek, a congressional aide with whom the former U.S. House speaker has a relationship.
prev_text_2: Wednesday's motion was among several filed by Gingrich this week in an effort to take the offensive against his wife, who has aggressively sought to question him about personal and financial matters outside their marriage.

text_1_html: STARBUCKS - JOHNSON ( Seattle ) - Basketball legend Earvin " Magic " Johnson and Starbucks boss Howard Schultz brought their inner - city road show to Seattle 's Columbia City neighborhood Fridya .
text_2_html: Schultz 's Seattle - based Starbucks Coffee Co. and Johnson 's Los Angeles - based Johnson Development Corp. have recently opened similar Starbucks coffee stores in West Los Angeles and New York 's Harlem .
text_1: STARBUCKS-JOHNSON (Seattle) - Basketball legend Earvin "Magic" Johnson and Starbucks boss Howard Schultz brought their inner-city road show to Seattle's Columbia City neighborhood Fridya.
prev_text_1: (Story will move in the "a" category.)
text_2: Schultz's Seattle-based Starbucks Coffee Co. and Johnson's Los Angeles-based Johnson Development Corp. have recently opened similar Starbucks coffee stores in West Los Angeles and New York's Harlem.
prev_text_2: They opened the latest in their 50-50 joint-venture Starbucks Coffee stores and Johnson said there will be more in Seattle, along with one of Johnson's multiplex movie theaters.

text_1_html: The Swiss - British team hoping to be the first to fly a balloon around the world nonstop passed south of Japan today , trying to avoid thunderstorms that ended the flight of a rival team this week .
text_2_html: On March 7 , two British balloonists abandoned their attempt because of bad weather , landing in the Pacific near Japan .
text_1: The Swiss-British team hoping to be the first to fly a balloon around the world nonstop passed south of Japan today, trying to avoid thunderstorms that ended the flight of a rival team this week.
text_2: On March 7, two British balloonists abandoned their attempt because of bad weather, landing in the Pacific near Japan.
prev_text_2: A U.S.-Australian team canceled its planned attempt in mid-January.

text_1_html: The academy , the nation 's largest group of pediatricians , said it is unclear whether the disorder is being overdiagnosed , because doctors ' definitions and treatment of it varies widely .
text_2_html: A committee of psychiatrists , neurologists , pediatricians , pharmacologists and educators will listen to experts on different sides of the controversy before attempting Wednesday to issue a " consensus statement " on ADHD and its treatment .
text_1: The academy, the nation's largest group of pediatricians, said it is unclear whether the disorder is being overdiagnosed, because doctors' definitions and treatment of it varies widely.
prev_text_1: However, recent research shows dramatic increases in the use of drugs like Ritalin to treat children with ADHD, suggesting the disorder is either becoming more common or is being overdiagnosed.
text_2: A committee of psychiatrists, neurologists, pediatricians, pharmacologists and educators will listen to experts on different sides of the controversy before attempting Wednesday to issue a "consensus statement" on ADHD and its treatment.
prev_text_2: In addition to methylphenidate, stimulates such as amphetamines are sometimes used to treat ADHD, but to a lesser extent.

text_1_html: Cunningham had admitted taking $ 2.4 million in bribes from defense contractors and evading more than $ 1 million in taxes .
text_2_html: Cunningham , 64 , resigned from Congress in November after pleading guilty to accepting $ 2.4 million in bribes _ including a Rolls - Royce , yachts , homes and antique furnishings _ in exchange for defense contracts and other favors .

text_1_html: The existing law on adoption placed excessive restrictions on people who are fully capable and willing to adopt children , and prolonged overcrowding in government institutions for orphans and handicapped minors , according to Doje .
text_2_html: In a report submitted to the 4th meeting of the 9th NPC Standing Committee last Monday , Doje Cering , minister of civil affairs , said that the draft has stricter requirements on adoption of Chinese children by foreigners , but Wan pointed out today that " requirements " means adoption procedures .
text_1: The existing law on adoption placed excessive restrictions on people who are fully capable and willing to adopt children, and prolonged overcrowding in government institutions for orphans and handicapped minors, according to Doje.
prev_text_1: He said the purposed relaxing restrictions on domestic adoptions are to provide more orphans with access to family warmth and ensure healthy growth.

prev_text_2: A draft of the Adoption Law has relaxed restrictions in many aspects for Chinese and foreigners who apply for adoptions, according to a member of the National People's Congress (NPC) Standing Committee, Wan Shaofen, who was debating the draft.

text_1_html: " Online bookselling has had this extraordinary growth , " Givler said , " but nobody knows how that is going to play out .
text_2_html: But with the rise of online bookselling and instant purchases at the click of a computer mouse , book clubs in the late 1990s were forced to offer something more than discounts .
text_1: "Online bookselling has had this extraordinary growth," Givler said, "but nobody knows how that is going to play out.
prev_text_1: Some university presses are starting to experiment by publishing electronic journals, he said, but to date it is unclear to the members whether online bookselling and electronic publishing will be a boon.
text_2: But with the rise of online bookselling and instant purchases at the click of a computer mouse, book clubs in the late 1990s were forced to offer something more than discounts.
prev_text_2: For readers living far from a bookstore, the system offered a convenient alternative.

text_1_html: After extensive investigation of recovered aircraft parts and both black box data recorders , NTSB investigators found no evidence that mechanical or electrical problems or an explosion caused the crash .
text_2_html: After an examination of the flight data recorder , the cockpit voice recorder , radar data and small amounts of wreckage , Hall said in November that there was no sign of mechanical failure that could have caused the crash .

text_1_html: Investigators , zeroing in on the static ports after reviewing the two flight recorders , eventually found that maintenance workers had covered the 757 's static ports with protective masking tape when they washed the plane , and had neglected to remove it - an oversight that meant the pilots could not read their airspeed from the instruments and flew the plane to its doom .
text_2_html: Despite the puzzling final minutes of the flight and the lack of any clear - cut cause emerging from the first analyses of the two black boxes - the flight data and cockpit voice recorders - Hall was optimistic that the cause would eventually be pinpointed .
text_1: Investigators, zeroing in on the static ports after reviewing the two flight recorders, eventually found that maintenance workers had covered the 757's static ports with protective masking tape when they washed the plane, and had neglected to remove it - an oversight that meant the pilots could not read their airspeed from the instruments and flew the plane to its doom.
prev_text_1: The static ports are crucial because speed cannot be determined visually from a jet flying at high altitude at night, and if a plane flies too fast or too slow, it will crash.
text_2: Despite the puzzling final minutes of the flight and the lack of any clear-cut cause emerging from the first analyses of the two black boxes - the flight data and cockpit voice recorders - Hall was optimistic that the cause would eventually be pinpointed.
prev_text_2: After descending to 16,700 feet, the plane climbed to about 24,000 feet then went into a final dive and started breaking up before slamming into the Altantic Ocean.
alignments: [{'sent1': [['DUC2006~!~D0617h~!~NYT19991109.0379~!~158~!~2~!~zeroing~!~3192', 'What did someone zero in on? - the static ports', 'zeroing']], 'sent2': [['DUC2006~!~D0617h~!~NYT19991115.0260~!~240~!~45~!~pinpointed~!~2872', 'What would be pinpointed? - the cause', 'pinpointed']]}]

text_1_html: WASHINGTON ( AP ) -- American Indian reservations would get an infusion of $ 1.2 billion in federal money for education , health care and law enforcement under President Clinton 's proposed 2001 budget , a White House aide said .
text_2_html: Among the spending Clinton will seek : $ 300 million to build at least six new reservation schools , a $ 117 million increase for reservation road repairs , about $ 300 million more for the Indian Health Service and $ 103 million added to reservation law enforcement , Cutler said .
text_1: WASHINGTON (AP) -- American Indian reservations would get an infusion of $1.2 billion in federal money for education, health care and law enforcement under President Clinton's proposed 2001 budget, a White House aide said.
text_2: Among the spending Clinton will seek: $300 million to build at least six new reservation schools, a $117 million increase for reservation road repairs, about $300 million more for the Indian Health Service and $103 million added to reservation law enforcement, Cutler said.
prev_text_2: Those will be included in his 2001 budget proposal, to be announced next week.

text_1_html: BEIJING ( AP ) - Chinese couples will find it easier and foreigners perhaps more difficult to adopt children under a revised adoption law approved by China 's legislature Wednesday , state media reported .
text_2_html: In a report submitted to the 4th meeting of the 9th NPC Standing Committee last Monday , Doje Cering , minister of civil affairs , said that the draft has stricter requirements on adoption of Chinese children by foreigners , but Wan pointed out today that " requirements " means adoption procedures .
text_1: BEIJING (AP) - Chinese couples will find it easier and foreigners perhaps more difficult to adopt children under a revised adoption law approved by China's legislature Wednesday, state media reported.
text_2: In a report submitted to the 4th meeting of the 9th NPC Standing Committee last Monday, Doje Cering, minister of civil affairs, said that the draft has stricter requirements on adoption of Chinese children by foreigners, but Wan pointed out today that "requirements" means adoption procedures.
prev_text_2: A draft of the Adoption Law has relaxed restrictions in many aspects for Chinese and foreigners who apply for adoptions, according to a member of the National People's Congress (NPC) Standing Committee, Wan Shaofen, who was debating the draft.

text_1_html: During La Nina , which typically lasts at least a year , dry conditions take hold of South America , Africa has alternate periods of drought and flooding and rains return to Asia .
text_2_html: For many parts of the Americas and Asia , the occasional warming and cooling cycles in the tropical Pacific Ocean known as El Nino and La Nina are unwelcome visitors - barging in , usually with little warning , then staying for months or sometimes a year or two , bringing all kinds of baggage in the form of distorted patterns of storms and droughts , heat and cold .
text_1: During La Nina, which typically lasts at least a year, dry conditions take hold of South America, Africa has alternate periods of drought and flooding and rains return to Asia.
prev_text_1: La Nina, Spanish for "little girl," is just the opposite, with the warm conditions of El Nino returning to the west.
text_2: For many parts of the Americas and Asia, the occasional warming and cooling cycles in the tropical Pacific Ocean known as El Nino and La Nina are unwelcome visitors - barging in, usually with little warning, then staying for months or sometimes a year or two, bringing all kinds of baggage in the form of distorted patterns of storms and droughts, heat and cold.

text_1_html: During La Nina , which typically lasts at least a year , dry conditions take hold of South America , Africa has alternate periods of drought and flooding and rains return to Asia .
text_2_html: For many parts of the Americas and Asia , the occasional warming and cooling cycles in the tropical Pacific Ocean known as El Nino and La Nina are unwelcome visitors - barging in , usually with little warning , then staying for months or sometimes a year or two , bringing all kinds of baggage in the form of distorted patterns of storms and droughts , heat and cold .

text_1_html: " One of the key questions in the evaluation is has the child always had difficulty sitting still , sustaining attention to a task , or is this something new , " said Gold , who added that often behavioral and other educational help is tried first before approaching medication .
text_2_html: An estimated 2 million children in the United States have attention deficit hyperactivity disorder ( ADHD ) , which is marked by symptoms that include inattention , distractibility and hyperactivity .
text_1: "One of the key questions in the evaluation is has the child always had difficulty sitting still, sustaining attention to a task, or is this something new," said Gold, who added that often behavioral and other educational help is tried first before approaching medication.
prev_text_1: Severe marital stress or financial stress in the household can affect the child, and other psychiatric problems can overlap or mimic ADHD, such as severe anxiety.
text_2: An estimated 2 million children in the United States have attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), which is marked by symptoms that include inattention, distractibility and hyperactivity.
prev_text_2: Funding for the research came from Shire Richwood Inc., a subsidiary of Adderall manufacturer Shire Pharmaceuticals.

text_2_html: Analyzing cells from milk ducts doesn't reliably detect breast cancer, U.S. researchers reported Tuesday _ dashing hopes that the experimental technique could diagnose high-risk women sooner.

text_1_html: Pyongyang insists on having nuclear power for peaceful purposes , something opposed by the U.S. South Korea has promised massive aid to North Korea , including electricity , rice , and other necessities , if an agreement can be reached within the six - party framework .
text_2_html: The talks have hit a snag over North Korea 's insistence that it be allowed to possess nuclear power for what it describes as " peaceful means , " a stance opposed by the United States .
text_1: Pyongyang insists on having nuclear power for peaceful purposes, something opposed by the U.S. South Korea has promised massive aid to North Korea, including electricity, rice, and other necessities, if an agreement can be reached within the six-party framework.
prev_text_1: South Korea, the U.S., Japan, China, and Russia want North Korea to abandon its development of nuclear weapons.
text_2: The talks have hit a snag over North Korea's insistence that it be allowed to possess nuclear power for what it describes as "peaceful means," a stance opposed by the United States.

text_1_html: Newt and Callista were married in August 2000 .

text_1_html: Raj K . Chohan was walking alongside parked cars on 117th Street and 97th Avenue at about 7 p . m . when she was struck by a gray 2013 Toyota Camry , which then sped off , according to cops .
text_2_html: An initial investigation of the scene revealed that Chohan had been walking alongside the parked cars on 117th Street when she was struck by a vehicle heading northbound , police said .
text_1: Raj K . Chohan was walking alongside parked cars on 117th Street and 97th Avenue at about 7 p . m . when she was struck by a gray 2013 Toyota Camry , which then sped off , according to cops .
prev_text_1: A 59 - year - old woman was killed in a hit - and - run crash while visiting a former neighbor to welcome his new daughter - in - law to the family Friday evening , and the man allegedly behind the wheel of the car that hit her was charged with driving drunk , police and the woman  s friend said .

text_1_html: A former employee walked into a staff Christmas party at an east Vancouver health products business Friday and shot and killed a man , according to police .
text_2_html: A just- fired employee of a Canadian health products company crashed the office Christmas party in Vancouver , killing the chief executive officer , police said .

text_1_html: An accounting firm employee who was fired last week shot and killed a woman and wounded two men Monday at the suburban Detroit building where he worked , then led officers on a high - speed chase , police said .
text_2_html: A fired accountant bought a shotgun the day after he lost his job , then returned to the office the following week and opened fire on his bosses , wounding both and killing a receptionist , the Associated Press reported .

text_1_html: Other studies are looking into the effects and effectiveness of oral contraceptives , an underactive thyroid , olive oil , a cell 's ability to repair DNA , and the flushing of milk ducts .
text_2_html: Analyzing cells from milk ducts doesn't reliably detect breast cancer, U.S. researchers reported Tuesday _ dashing hopes that the experimental technique could diagnose high-risk women sooner.
text_1: Other studies are looking into the effects and effectiveness of oral contraceptives, an underactive thyroid, olive oil, a cell's ability to repair DNA, and the flushing of milk ducts.

text_1_html: Battered by chain stores and the on - line giant Amazon.com , one out of every three of New England 's independent booksellers has created sophisticated yet quirky Web sites in the past two years in an effort to lure patrons and keep their doors open .
text_2_html: " A lot of sellers are finding that their on - line presence subsidizes their storefront ; that just warms my heart , " Chatterjee said .

text_2: "A lot of sellers are finding that their on-line presence subsidizes their storefront; that just warms my heart," Chatterjee said.

text_1_html: Rudolph was connected to the Alabama bombing but escaped a police dragnet and , loaded up with food and supplies , hid for five and a half months in the woods of western North Carolina .
text_2_html: Six months later , Rudolph was identified by a food store owner near Nantahale Lake in Western North Carolina not far from where he first lived .

text_1_html: After leaving Alderson at 12:30 a.m. on March 3 , 2005 , Martha Steward declared the 5-month experience as " life altering and life affirming . "
text_2_html: Martha Stewart , the billionaire entrepreneur who was convicted a year ago of lying to federal investigators , left prison early Friday in Alderson , W.Va . , after serving a five - month sentence .
text_1: After leaving Alderson at 12:30 a.m. on March 3, 2005, Martha Steward declared the 5-month experience as "life altering and life affirming."

text_1_html: By 1998 the two sides were still at loggerheads over withdrawal from the West Bank although they should have reached final status talks two years earlier according to the accords .

text_1_html: MOSCOW ( AP ) - President Boris Yeltsin Saturday signed a revised adoption law that would tighten control over foreign adoptions and encourage more Russians to adopt children .
text_2_html: The anxiety among prospective parents -- and among adoption practitioners throughout the United States -- stems from a series of new laws in Russia that promise to radically alter adoption practices within that country and , as a result , possibly change the face of international adoption .
text_1: MOSCOW (AP) - President Boris Yeltsin Saturday signed a revised adoption law that would tighten control over foreign adoptions and encourage more Russians to adopt children.
text_2: The anxiety among prospective parents -- and among adoption practitioners throughout the United States -- stems from a series of new laws in Russia that promise to radically alter adoption practices within that country and, as a result, possibly change the face of international adoption.
prev_text_2: "We're optimistic the adoptions will eventually go through ... but the uncertainty makes people agitated, and the ones in line the longest are up in arms."

text_1_html: The Indian navy said it arrested 23 pirates who threatened a merchant vessel in the Gulf of Aden on Saturday , the latest in a series of recent clashes with Somali pirates .
text_2_html: The Indian Navy said Saturday it had captured 23 pirates as they tried to board an Ethiopian-flagged vessel in the Gulf of Aden .

text_1_html: Vice President Al Gore said Sunday his campaign chairman , Tony Coelho , is " doing a great job " and will stay on despite a government report that found questionable financial management while Coelho directed the U.S. pavilion at the 1998 world 's fair in Portugal .
text_2_html: " He is staying , and I have n't seen this report , but I know him and he is going to continue doing the terrific job that he 's been doing as my campaign chair , " Gore said on CBS 's " Face the Nation . "

text_1_html: Billy King spun the 76ers' head coach revolving door again yesterday , pushing out Jim O'Brien after just one season and bringing in Maurice Cheeks , the popular former Sixers player and assistant coach , as O'Brien's replacement .
text_2_html: In a surprising move nearly three weeks following the end of their season , the Sixers fired Jim O'Brien on Monday after one season as coach and replaced him with Cheeks , one of the most popular players in franchise history .

text_1_html: A Michigan man shot to death one person and injured two others Monday at the suburban Detroit accounting firm from which he was fired last week , police said .
text_2_html: An accounting firm employee who was fired last week shot and killed a woman and wounded two men Monday at the suburban Detroit building where he worked , then led officers on a high - speed chase , police said .

text_1_html: 1 dead , 2 hurt in Mich . office shooting ; police say suspect had worked there
text_2_html: An accounting firm employee who was fired last week shot and killed a woman and wounded two men Monday at the suburban Detroit building where he worked , then led officers on a high - speed chase , police said .

text_1_html: Emergency responders are voluntarily assisting but humane societies are requesting a policy that local , state and federal responders will diligently assist with pet rescues .
text_2_html: The Humane Society appealed for Louisiana state authorities and federal officials to intervene to ensure that any animals abandoned as residents fled New Orleans more than two weeks ago are rounded up and sent to rescue centres .
text_1: Emergency responders are voluntarily assisting but humane societies are requesting a policy that local, state and federal responders will diligently assist with pet rescues.
prev_text_1: 5,000 plus have been rescued but thousands have perished.
text_2: The Humane Society appealed for Louisiana state authorities and federal officials to intervene to ensure that any animals abandoned as residents fled New Orleans more than two weeks ago are rounded up and sent to rescue centres.
prev_text_2: He said that troops were authorised to destroy dogs that were found to be interfering with human bodies left on the streets as floodwaters from Hurricane Katrina receded.

text_1_html: One man is dead after an ex-employee opened fire at his company 's Christmas party at a Vancouver , B.C. business Friday night .
text_2_html: A former employee walked into a staff Christmas party at an east Vancouver health products business Friday and allegedly shot and killed a man .

text_1_html: The Senate Judiciary Committee met with Metallica drummer Lars Ulrich and online music executives to discuss the effects on the recording industry of downloading music on the Internet .

text_1_html: Martha Stewart , the billionaire entrepreneur who was convicted a year ago of lying to federal investigators , left prison early Friday in Alderson , W.Va . , after serving a five - month sentence .
text_2_html: As part of her sentence , Stewart was ordered to serve five months at the federal women 's camp in Alderson .

text_1: Martha Stewart, the billionaire entrepreneur who was convicted a year ago of lying to federal investigators, left prison early Friday in Alderson, W.Va., after serving a five-month sentence.
text_2: As part of her sentence, Stewart was ordered to serve five months at the federal women's camp in Alderson.

text_1_html: Indian Navy patrolling the Gulf of Aden yesterday thwarted a multi - boat attack by sea brigands on merchant vessels , apprehending 26 Somali pirates and confiscating arms and ammunition , in the fifth successful anti - piracy operation since September .
text_2_html: New Delhi / Mumbai : An Indian warship foiled a five - boat pirate attack on merchant vessels transiting the Gulf of Aden on Friday capturing 26 Somani brigands on three of the skiffs and confiscating their weapons .

text_1_html: A recent survey found that almost two thirds of traditional US medical schools now teach alternative therapies , including chiropractic , acupuncture , herbal remedies and mind - body medicine .
text_2_html: Almost two - thirds of traditional U.S. medical schools now teach alternative therapies , including chiropractic , acupuncture , herbal remedies and mind - body medicine , a survey found .
text_1: A recent survey found that almost two thirds of traditional US medical schools now teach alternative therapies, including chiropractic, acupuncture, herbal remedies and mind-body medicine.
prev_text_1: As the trend grows towards a, "complementary" medical model, hospitals, medical centers and senior centers are exploring the prospects of integrating conventional Western medical approaches with Eastern therapies including acupuncture.
text_2: Almost two-thirds of traditional U.S. medical schools now teach alternative therapies, including chiropractic, acupuncture, herbal remedies and mind-body medicine, a survey found.

text_1_html: But putting a hate group out of business is n't easy : While Dees has won significant civil judgments against the Ku Klux Klan and the White Aryan Resistance , the groups have survived .
text_2_html: Morris S. Dees Jr. , who has won a series of civil rights suits against the Ku Klux Klan and other racist groups in a campaign to put them out of business , came to court here Monday to try to seize the Aryan Nations compound that has nurtured white supremacists for more than 20 years .
text_1: But putting a hate group out of business isn't easy: While Dees has won significant civil judgments against the Ku Klux Klan and the White Aryan Resistance, the groups have survived.

text_1_html: Police say a Perth mountain climber who watched his brother fall over the edge of New Zealand 's highest mountain is devastated .
text_2_html: A Perth man has survived after spending up to two nights in an ice cave on New Zealand 's Mt Cook after seeing his brother fall to his death from the country 's highest peak .

text_1_html: The Philadelphia 76ers fired Coach Maurice Cheeks Saturday morning after a disappointing 9-14 start to the 2008-09 season .
text_2_html: But the 76ers , while underachieving at 9-14 when Cheeks was fired Saturday morning , were not an embarassment when they went on the court , not a disjointed bunch that clearly was no longer listening to or playing for its coach .
text_1: The Philadelphia 76ers fired Coach Maurice Cheeks Saturday morning after a disappointing 9-14 start to the 2008-09 season .
text_2: But the 76ers , while underachieving at 9-14 when Cheeks was fired Saturday morning , were not an embarassment when they went on the court , not a disjointed bunch that clearly was no longer listening to or playing for its coach .
prev_text_2: Like all coaches not in the upper stratosphere of the coaching hierarchy -- your Phil Jacksons and Gregg Popoviches -- he was only as good as his last 10-game stretch , only as secure as how well his star was playing .

text_1_html: The powerful quakes in Papua in easternmost of Indonesia on Sunday have led over 14,000 people taking shelters in tents , destroyed hundreds of buildings , killed one person and injured dozens others , local disaster management agency said on Monday .
text_2_html: A series of powerful earthquakes rocked Manokwari , the capital of West Papua , on Sunday , killing four people , injuring dozens and destroying hundreds of buildings .

text_1_html: Chargers defensive lineman Jamal Williams was arrested early Sunday on suspicion of drunken driving after he was speeding down state Route 94 , the California Highway Patrol said .

text_1_html: Morris S. Dees Jr. , who has won a series of civil rights suits against the Ku Klux Klan and other racist groups in a campaign to put them out of business , came to court here Monday to try to seize the Aryan Nations compound that has nurtured white supremacists for more than 20 years .
text_2_html: Over the last two decades , the Southern Poverty Law Center has taken the Ku Klux Klan and other hate groups to court , starting with a successful suit against the Invisible Empire Klan , which in 1979 attacked a group of peaceful civil rights marchers in Decatur , Ala.
text_1: Morris S. Dees Jr., who has won a series of civil rights suits against the Ku Klux Klan and other racist groups in a campaign to put them out of business, came to court here Monday to try to seize the Aryan Nations compound that has nurtured white supremacists for more than 20 years.
text_2: Over the last two decades, the Southern Poverty Law Center has taken the Ku Klux Klan and other hate groups to court, starting with a successful suit against the Invisible Empire Klan, which in 1979 attacked a group of peaceful civil rights marchers in Decatur, Ala.
prev_text_2: Mark Thomas, the leader of the Aryan Nations in Pennsylvania, confessed to being part of another terrorist group, the Aryan Republican Army, that in the mid-1990s robbed 22 Midwestern banks in an effort to finance a white supremacist revolution.

text_1_html: A Perth man has survived after spending up to two nights in an ice cave on New Zealand 's Mt Cook after seeing his brother fall to his death from the country 's highest peak .
text_2_html: A climber who watched his brother fall to his death from a notorious ridge on Mt Cook , is lucky to be alive after two `` horrific '' nights high on the mountain .

text_1_html: Israel on Monday tried to repair any damage done to relations with Cyprus after the weekend arrest of two Israelis on suspicion of spying for the Greek Cypriot government 's enemy , Turkey .
text_2_html: Writing for the Israeli newspaper Yediot Ahronot , Ron Ben Yishai , a security expert , said the highly publicized arrests were meant to send " a warning to Israel lest it decide to provide Turkey with any intelligence or military assistance in its fight against Greek Cyprus . "

text_2: Writing for the Israeli newspaper Yediot Ahronot, Ron Ben Yishai, a security expert, said the highly publicized arrests were meant to send "a warning to Israel lest it decide to provide Turkey with any intelligence or military assistance in its fight against Greek Cyprus."
prev_text_2: He later retracted this description, saying he had not expressed himself well.

text_1_html: A powerful earthquake in Indonesia's Aceh province flattened buildings and sparked landslides Tuesday , killing at least five people and injuring dozens in a region devastated by the quake - triggered tsunami of 2004 .
text_2_html: A 6 . 1 - magnitude earthquake which hit the Indonesian province of Aceh on Tuesday killed at least one person , injured dozens and destroyed buildings , sparking panic in a region devastated by the quake - triggered tsunami of 2004 .

text_1_html: The Philadelphia 76ers fired Coach Maurice Cheeks Saturday morning after a disappointing 9-14 start to the 2008-09 season .
text_2_html: Maurice Cheeks was fired Saturday as coach of the Philadelphia 76ers , who are slumping at 9-14 a year after making the playoffs .

text_1_html: A Perth man has survived after spending up to two nights in an ice cave on New Zealand 's Mt Cook after seeing his brother fall to his death from the country 's highest peak .
text_2_html: An Australian climber who survived two nights stuck on Mount Cook after seeing his brother die also narrowly escaped being buried alive himself .

text_1_html: A powerful earthquake in Indonesia's Aceh province flattened buildings and sparked landslides Tuesday , killing at least five people and injuring dozens in a region devastated by the quake - triggered tsunami of 2004 .
text_2_html: A 6 . 1 - magnitude earthquake which hit the Indonesian province of Aceh on Tuesday killed a child , injured dozens and destroyed buildings , sparking panic in a region devastated by the quake - triggered tsunami of 2004 .

text_1_html: Private investors are set to benefit from the 1999 introduction of the single European currency , the euro , thanks to expanded investment opportunities , reduced currency risks , and rising competitions , the German central bank Bundesbank said Monday .
text_2_html: In its latest monthly report issued Monday , the Bundesbank said that as national currency boundaries vanish and most European stocks and bonds are denominated in euros , investors will be able to make use of a variety of cross - border investment opportunities in the euro area which will become the second largest capital market in the world .

text_1_html: Yesterday evening the new tenant of the Tardis was unveiled as Peter Capaldi stepped into Matt Smith's soon to be vacant Doctor Who shoes as the twelfth incarnation of the Time Lord .
text_2_html: Doctor Who has finally selected its 12th doctor : Peter Capaldi is officially set to replace exiting star Matt Smith as the TARDIS leader , producer Steven Moffat announced on the live BBC special Doctor Who Live : The Next Doctor Sunday .

text_1_html: Philadelphia 76ers management had enough of the NBA team lurking near the bottom of the Eastern Conference standings and fired head coach Maurice Cheeks on Saturday .
text_2_html: But the 76ers , while underachieving at 9-14 when Cheeks was fired Saturday morning , were not an embarassment when they went on the court , not a disjointed bunch that clearly was no longer listening to or playing for its coach .

text_2: But the 76ers , while underachieving at 9-14 when Cheeks was fired Saturday morning , were not an embarassment when they went on the court , not a disjointed bunch that clearly was no longer listening to or playing for its coach .
prev_text_2: Like all coaches not in the upper stratosphere of the coaching hierarchy -- your Phil Jacksons and Gregg Popoviches -- he was only as good as his last 10-game stretch , only as secure as how well his star was playing .

text_1_html: In its latest monthly report issued Monday , the Bundesbank said that as national currency boundaries vanish and most European stocks and bonds are denominated in euros , investors will be able to make use of a variety of cross - border investment opportunities in the euro area which will become the second largest capital market in the world .
text_2_html: Moreover , investors are also set to benefit from reduced transaction costs and improved market transparency resulting from heated competitions among financial institutions after the advent of the euro , the Bundesbank said .
text_1: In its latest monthly report issued Monday, the Bundesbank said that as national currency boundaries vanish and most European stocks and bonds are denominated in euros, investors will be able to make use of a variety of cross-border investment opportunities in the euro area which will become the second largest capital market in the world.
prev_text_1: Private investors are set to benefit from the 1999 introduction of the single European currency, the euro, thanks to expanded investment opportunities, reduced currency risks, and rising competitions, the German central bank Bundesbank said Monday.
text_2: Moreover, investors are also set to benefit from reduced transaction costs and improved market transparency resulting from heated competitions among financial institutions after the advent of the euro, the Bundesbank said.
prev_text_2: In its latest monthly report issued Monday, the Bundesbank said that as national currency boundaries vanish and most European stocks and bonds are denominated in euros, investors will be able to make use of a variety of cross-border investment opportunities in the euro area which will become the second largest capital market in the world.

text_1_html: The Justice Department and 20 states suing Microsoft in the antitrust case say that this is part of a pattern of illegal practices by the software giant intended to protect and extend its tight grip on the market for personal computer software .
text_2_html: May 18 - After the settlement negotiations fail , the Justice Department and 20 states file a broad antitrust suit against Microsoft .
text_1: The Justice Department and 20 states suing Microsoft in the antitrust case say that this is part of a pattern of illegal practices by the software giant intended to protect and extend its tight grip on the market for personal computer software.
prev_text_1: But the allegations in the government's antitrust suit do include the practices that are at the heart of the breach-of-contract case Sun filed against Microsoft last October - namely, that Microsoft is trying to "pollute" Sun's Internet programming language, called Java, by modifying it.
text_2: May 18 - After the settlement negotiations fail, the Justice Department and 20 states file a broad antitrust suit against Microsoft.
prev_text_2: May 14 - Microsoft and the Justice Department reveal that they are conducting settlement talks aimed at heading off a wide-ranging antitrust action.

text_1_html: Morris S. Dees Jr. , who has won a series of civil rights suits against the Ku Klux Klan and other racist groups in a campaign to put them out of business , came to court here Monday to try to seize the Aryan Nations compound that has nurtured white supremacists for more than 20 years .
text_2_html: In 1987 , the center won a $ 7 million verdict for the mother of Michael Donald , a black youth who had been lynched by members of the United Klans of America in Mobile , Ala.
text_1: Morris S. Dees Jr., who has won a series of civil rights suits against the Ku Klux Klan and other racist groups in a campaign to put them out of business, came to court here Monday to try to seize the Aryan Nations compound that has nurtured white supremacists for more than 20 years.
text_2: In 1987, the center won a $7 million verdict for the mother of Michael Donald, a black youth who had been lynched by members of the United Klans of America in Mobile, Ala.
prev_text_2: Over the last two decades, the Southern Poverty Law Center has taken the Ku Klux Klan and other hate groups to court, starting with a successful suit against the Invisible Empire Klan, which in 1979 attacked a group of peaceful civil rights marchers in Decatur, Ala.

text_1_html: In a surprising move nearly three weeks following the end of their season , the Sixers fired Jim O'Brien on Monday after one season as coach and replaced him with Cheeks , one of the most popular players in franchise history .

text_1_html: Reaching back to television for a comedy star , the producers of the Academy Awards telecast announced Friday that Ellen DeGeneres would return next year to host the annual Oscar ceremony .
text_2_html: Television icon Ellen DeGeneres will return to host the Oscars for a second time , producers Craig Zadan and Neil Meron announced today .

text_1_html: President-elect Barack Obama has asked neurosurgeon and CNN medical correspondent Dr. Sanjay Gupta to be U.S. surgeon general , a senior Democrat said on Tuesday .
text_2_html: Gupta has been `` the Obama team 's first choice '' for the job , which would make the TV personality America 's top doctor , said the Democrat who is familiar with efforts by Obama to staff his pending administration .

text_1_html: An earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 4.4 struck in Sonoma County this morning near The Geysers , according to the U.S. Geological Survey .
text_2_html: The earthquake struck at about 9:30 a.m. and had a depth of 2.7 miles , according to the USGS .

text_1_html: Atururi said a 10-year-old girl was killed and at least 40 people were injured in the earthquakes , which rekindled bitter memories of similar deadly quakes that hit the town in 2002 .
text_2_html: The powerful quakes in Papua in easternmost of Indonesia on Sunday have led over 14,000 people taking shelters in tents , destroyed hundreds of buildings , killed one person and injured dozens others , local disaster management agency said on Monday .

text_1_html: Unlike on Nov. 12 , when sobs filled the air as Peterson was found guilty of murdering his wife and their unborn child , there was an almost surreal stillness in the courtroom while the death recommendation was announced .
text_2_html: A jury found Scott Peterson guilty Friday of killing his pregnant wife , Laci , and their unborn child in the saga of suburban adultery and betrayal that transfixed much of the nation for nearly two years .
text_1: Unlike on Nov. 12 , when sobs filled the air as Peterson was found guilty of murdering his wife and their unborn child , there was an almost surreal stillness in the courtroom while the death recommendation was announced .
prev_text_1: The case first captured the nation 's attention when Laci Peterson disappeared from her Modesto home the day before Christmas 2002 and has engrossed the country ever since .
text_2: A jury found Scott Peterson guilty Friday of killing his pregnant wife , Laci , and their unborn child in the saga of suburban adultery and betrayal that transfixed much of the nation for nearly two years .

text_1_html: T-Mobile USA has just confirmed the numerous rumors that it will introduce the latest model in the BlackBerry Curve series next month .
text_2_html: Rumors have been floating for weeks now and we knew the 8900 would be coming sometime in early '09 and tonight T-Mobile has made it official .

text_1_html: The jury convicted the 32-year-old Peterson on Nov. 12 of first-degree murder for killing his wife and second-degree murder for the death of his unborn son .
text_2_html: A jury found Scott Peterson guilty Friday of killing his pregnant wife , Laci , and their unborn child in the saga of suburban adultery and betrayal that transfixed much of the nation for nearly two years .
text_1: The jury convicted the 32-year-old Peterson on Nov. 12 of first-degree murder for killing his wife and second-degree murder for the death of his unborn son .

text_1_html: AMD ( NYSE : AMD ) today announced it has signed a definitive agreement to acquire SeaMicro , a pioneer in energy - efficient , high - bandwidth microservers , for approximately $334 million , of which approximately $281 million will be paid in cash .
text_2_html: Advanced Micro Devices announced Wednesday it is buying low - power server vendor SeaMicro , a surprise move that puts AMD in the systems business and disrupts Intel by acquiring one of its close partners .

text_1_html: The strong 6 . 1 - magnitude quake left hundreds more injured as it rocked a region that was devastated by the quake - triggered tsunami of 2004 .
text_2_html: A 6 . 1 - magnitude earthquake which hit the Indonesian province of Aceh on Tuesday killed a child , injured dozens and destroyed buildings , sparking panic in a region devastated by the quake - triggered tsunami of 2004 .

prev_text_1: AN EARTHQUAKE killed six children and left 14 others trapped when a mosque collapsed during a Koran reading session in Indonesia's Aceh province , bringing the confirmed death toll from the disaster to 11 .

text_1_html: The 4.2-magnitude earthquake was recorded at approximately 9:27 a.m. Sunday , according to the US Geological Survey , which originally had rated the quake as 4.4 in magnitude .
text_2_html: The U.S. Geological Survey says the 4.4-magnitude temblor on Sunday at 9:27 a.m. was centered 23 miles north of Santa Rosa , and two miles from The Geysers .

text_1_html: Chipmaker AMD , hoping to gain a leg up on a resurgent rival Intel ( INTC ) , on July 24 ended months of speculation by saying it would buy graphics chipmaker ATI for about $ 5.4 billion .
text_2_html: Advanced Micro Devices ( NYSE : AMD ) announced the largest acquisition in its history Monday , paying about $ 5.4 billion to acquire graphics chip specialist ATI Technologies .
text_1: Chipmaker AMD , hoping to gain a leg up on a resurgent rival Intel ( INTC ) , on July 24 ended months of speculation by saying it would buy graphics chipmaker ATI for about $ 5.4 billion .

text_1_html: An earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 4.4 struck in Sonoma County this morning near The Geysers , according to the U.S. Geological Survey .
text_2_html: A 4.2 magnitude earthquake shook a remote area of eastern Sonoma County on Sunday morning , the largest in a flurry over the weekend , according to the U.S. Geological Survey .

text_1_html: Advanced Micro Devices announced Wednesday it is buying low - power server vendor SeaMicro , a surprise move that puts AMD in the systems business and disrupts Intel by acquiring one of its close partners .

text_1_html: A Texas jury convicted polygamist sect leader Warren Jeffs of child sexual assault Thursday in a case stemming from two young followers he took as brides in what his church calls "spiritual marriages . "
text_2_html: Warren Jeffs , leader of the polygamist FLDS religious sect , was sentenced to life in prison in Texas , convicted of sexually assaulting two girls , aged 15 and 12 , that he claimed as his 'brides . '

text_1_html: Prosecutors have charged 27 - year - old Christopher Kenyon Simpson with two counts of first - degree murder in the April 2012 shooting death of 20 - year - old Ka'Loni Flynn of Fort Smith and the resulting death of the fetus .
text_2_html: A Spiro man was found guilty of two counts of first - degree murder Thursday evening in the 2012 shooting death of a Fort Smith woman and the subsequent death of her 8 - to 12 - week - old fetus .

text_1_html: A refugee camp in South Sudan's Unity state was bombed Thursday , South Sudan officials and witnesses said , threatening to raise tensions with Sudan in the violence - plagued border region .
text_2_html: Military aircraft from Sudan crossed the new international border with South Sudan and dropped bombs Thursday in and around a camp filled with refugees , officials said .

text_1_html: External safety measures include security checks by armed officers assigned to the schools , student identification cards , random locker inspections , metal detectors , panic buttons in the classrooms , video cameras on school buses , and erection of fences , increased lighting , and trimming of shrubbery around the school .
text_2_html: At Seattle 's Ballard High School , principal Chuck Chinn followed the advice of district security officials and recently stepped up locker checks and random sweeps of students with hand - held metal detectors , a procedure that had only occasionally been used before the Colorado killings .
text_1: External safety measures include security checks by armed officers assigned to the schools, student identification cards, random locker inspections, metal detectors, panic buttons in the classrooms, video cameras on school buses, and erection of fences, increased lighting, and trimming of shrubbery around the school.
prev_text_1: However, since the violent occurrences in Littleton, Colorado and Jonesboro, Arkansas, school officials nationwide are taking precautions to prevent violence in their schools.
text_2: At Seattle's Ballard High School, principal Chuck Chinn followed the advice of district security officials and recently stepped up locker checks and random sweeps of students with hand-held metal detectors, a procedure that had only occasionally been used before the Colorado killings.
prev_text_2: In the aftermath of the worst school slayings in U.S. history, local secondary schools have beefed up security measures, from cracking down on even the mildest threat to launching random weapons sweeps of students with hand-held metal detectors.

text_1_html: An earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 4.4 struck in Sonoma County this morning near The Geysers , according to the U.S. Geological Survey .
text_2_html: The U.S. Geological Survey says the 4.4-magnitude temblor on Sunday at 9:27 a.m. was centered 23 miles north of Santa Rosa , and two miles from The Geysers .
text_1: An earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 4.4 struck in Sonoma County this morning near The Geysers , according to the U.S. Geological Survey .
text_2: The U.S. Geological Survey says the 4.4-magnitude temblor on Sunday at 9:27 a.m. was centered 23 miles north of Santa Rosa , and two miles from The Geysers .
prev_text_2: A light earthquake has struck Northern California , and there are no reports of injuries or damage .

text_1_html: The 55 - year older leader of the Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints was charged with sexual assault of a child after taking a 12 - year old girl and a 15 - year girl as "spiritual wives . "
text_2_html: Warren Jeffs , leader of the polygamist FLDS religious sect , was sentenced to life in prison in Texas , convicted of sexually assaulting two girls , aged 15 and 12 , that he claimed as his 'brides . '

text_2: Warren Jeffs , leader of the polygamist FLDS religious sect , was sentenced to life in prison in Texas , convicted of sexually assaulting two girls , aged 15 and 12 , that he claimed as his 'brides . '

text_1_html: The testimony and cross - examination of Norris will focus on a crucial allegation in the antitrust suit against Microsoft by the Justice Department and 19 states - that Microsoft uses the price it charges PC makers for its industry - standard Windows operating system to insure that they promote Microsoft software over competing software .
text_2_html: May 18 - After the settlement negotiations fail , the Justice Department and 20 states file a broad antitrust suit against Microsoft .
text_1: The testimony and cross-examination of Norris will focus on a crucial allegation in the antitrust suit against Microsoft by the Justice Department and 19 states - that Microsoft uses the price it charges PC makers for its industry-standard Windows operating system to insure that they promote Microsoft software over competing software.
prev_text_1: The effort to forge a closer relationship with IBM, which would have included a more favorable price for Windows, foundered mainly because IBM balked at close cooperation with Microsoft, according to Baber.
text_2: May 18 - After the settlement negotiations fail, the Justice Department and 20 states file a broad antitrust suit against Microsoft.
prev_text_2: May 14 - Microsoft and the Justice Department reveal that they are conducting settlement talks aimed at heading off a wide-ranging antitrust action.

text_1_html: A 6 . 1 - magnitude earthquake which hit the Indonesian province of Aceh on Tuesday killed a child , injured dozens and destroyed buildings , sparking panic in a region devastated by the quake - triggered tsunami of 2004 .
text_2_html: A strong 6 . 1 - magnitude earthquake struck Indonesia's northwestern province of Aceh today , causing buildings to collapse and injuring at least 50 people .

text_1_html: After weeks of speculation about what would be introduced at Macworld , Apple Inc. took the wraps off of updated iTunes and iLife software and unveiled a 17-inch MacBook Pro on Tuesday .
text_2_html: With a 17-inch MacBook Pro update unveiled at today 's Macworld 2009 keynote , Apple has finally brought an entire line of Mac portables into view .

text_1_html: RCMP Sgt. Tim Shields and Attorney-General Wally Oppal announced Wednesday that the RCMP arrested two Bountiful residents , Winston K. Blackmore , 52 , and James Oler , 44 , on charges of polygamy .
text_2_html: Shields said both Oler and Blackmore were arrested Wednesday morning without incident by eight plainclothes RCMP officers in unmarked vehicles .

text_1_html: Officials say at least 24 people were killed and more than 200 injured by the quake , which struck the western tip of Sumatra island on Tuesday .
text_2_html: A 6 . 1 - magnitude earthquake which hit the Indonesian province of Aceh on Tuesday killed at least one person , injured dozens and destroyed buildings , sparking panic in a region devastated by the quake - triggered tsunami of 2004 .

text_1_html: It made 70 recommendations for " fundamental transformation " of police race relations , such as : Officers would face heavy civil fines for racist behavior ; a Commission for Racial Quality would have power to investigate police ; racist language would be criminal ; double - jeopardy protection would be eliminated .
text_2_html: The commission was calling for reform of the Race Relations Act to include the police , and said there must be a determination to make racial equality a reality .
text_1: It made 70 recommendations for "fundamental transformation" of police race relations, such as: Officers would face heavy civil fines for racist behavior; a Commission for Racial Quality would have power to investigate police; racist language would be criminal; double-jeopardy protection would be eliminated.
prev_text_1: In Feb 1999, a government report found London's police force "riven with pernicious and institutionalized racism".
text_2: The commission was calling for reform of the Race Relations Act to include the police, and said there must be a determination to make racial equality a reality.
prev_text_2: Since the 1980s, the ratio of black and Asian people who are unemployed compared with the white population has risen sharply.

text_1_html: The 55 - year - old Scottish actor will replace Matt Smith , who announced in June that he was leaving the sci - fi show later this year .
text_2_html: Doctor Who has finally selected its 12th doctor : Peter Capaldi is officially set to replace exiting star Matt Smith as the TARDIS leader , producer Steven Moffat announced on the live BBC special Doctor Who Live : The Next Doctor Sunday .
text_1: The 55 - year - old Scottish actor will replace Matt Smith , who announced in June that he was leaving the sci - fi show later this year .
prev_text_1: Fans eagerly awaited the news , which was broadcast during a special live show on ABC this morning .
text_2: Doctor Who has finally selected its 12th doctor : Peter Capaldi is officially set to replace exiting star Matt Smith as the TARDIS leader , producer Steven Moffat announced on the live BBC special Doctor Who Live : The Next Doctor Sunday .
prev_text_2: Meet your new Time Lord !

text_1_html: After weeks of speculation about what would be introduced at Macworld , Apple Inc. took the wraps off of updated iTunes and iLife software and unveiled a 17-inch MacBook Pro on Tuesday .
text_2_html: Apple on Tuesday launched a refresh of the 17-inch MacBook Pro , giving the company 's largest laptop an eight-hour battery life , a faster Intel ( NSDQ : INTC ) processor , and better graphics capabilities .

text_1_html: Relatively unknown actor Matt Smith was named as the next face of TV 's most famous time traveller .
text_2_html: On Saturday , the 26-year-old was handed the keys to the Tardis when he was unveiled as the 11th Doctor Who , replacing David Tennant , who steps down later this year .

text_1_html: The Arctic 's atmosphere is warming twice as fast as elsewhere on earth , and experts have warned that the region 's ice could melt away completely by the end of this century , endangering many animal species and the traditional lifestyle of Inuits and Lapplanders .
text_2_html: Within a century the melting could lead to summertime ice - free ocean conditions not seen in the area in a million years , the group said Tuesday .
text_1: The Arctic's atmosphere is warming twice as fast as elsewhere on earth, and experts have warned that the region's ice could melt away completely by the end of this century, endangering many animal species and the traditional lifestyle of Inuits and Lapplanders.
text_2: Within a century the melting could lead to summertime ice-free ocean conditions not seen in the area in a million years, the group said Tuesday.

text_2_html: Within a century the melting could lead to summertime ice - free ocean conditions not seen in the area in a million years , the group said Tuesday .
text_1: The Arctic's atmosphere is warming twice as fast as elsewhere on earth, and experts have warned that the region's ice could melt away completely by the end of this century, endangering many animal species and the traditional lifestyle of Inuits and Lapplanders.
text_2: Within a century the melting could lead to summertime ice-free ocean conditions not seen in the area in a million years, the group said Tuesday.

text_1_html: A series of powerful earthquakes rocked Manokwari , the capital of West Papua , on Sunday , killing four people , injuring dozens and destroying hundreds of buildings .
text_2_html: A series of earthquakes killed a 10-year-old girl and injured dozens Sunday in remote eastern Indonesia and briefly triggered fears of another tsunami in a country still recovering from such a disaster in 2004 .

text_1_html: The testimony and cross - examination of Norris will focus on a crucial allegation in the antitrust suit against Microsoft by the Justice Department and 19 states - that Microsoft uses the price it charges PC makers for its industry - standard Windows operating system to insure that they promote Microsoft software over competing software .
text_2_html: Local press reports said that attorneys for the Justice Department and the 19 states that successfully sued Microsoft for antitrust violations are considering ways to break up the company as a method to curb anticompetitive practices.
text_1: The testimony and cross-examination of Norris will focus on a crucial allegation in the antitrust suit against Microsoft by the Justice Department and 19 states - that Microsoft uses the price it charges PC makers for its industry-standard Windows operating system to insure that they promote Microsoft software over competing software.
prev_text_1: The effort to forge a closer relationship with IBM, which would have included a more favorable price for Windows, foundered mainly because IBM balked at close cooperation with Microsoft, according to Baber.
text_2: Local press reports said that attorneys for the Justice Department and the 19 states that successfully sued Microsoft for antitrust violations are considering ways to break up the company as a method to curb anticompetitive practices.
prev_text_2: Antitrust lawyers from the U.S. Justice Department were summoned to the White House Tuesday to brief President Bill Clinton's legal and economic advisers about a range of options for dealing with Microsoft Corp., including splitting up the software giant.

text_1_html: The manhunt intensified again for abortion clinic bombing suspect Eric Rudolph after authorities said he took a truck and a six - month supply of food from a home last week .
text_2_html: After five and a half months in hiding , the man wanted for the fatal bombing of an Alabama abortion clinic emerged from the woods of western North Carolina last week , took a large amount of food and a pickup truck from a residence , then abandoned the truck and vanished once more , federal authorities said on Tuesday .

text_1_html: The powerful quakes in Papua in easternmost of Indonesia on Sunday have led over 14,000 people taking shelters in tents , destroyed hundreds of buildings , killed one person and injured dozens others , local disaster management agency said on Monday .
text_2_html: A series of earthquakes killed a 10-year-old girl and injured dozens Sunday in remote eastern Indonesia and briefly triggered fears of another tsunami in a country still recovering from such a disaster in 2004 .

text_1_html: The 55 - year older leader of the Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints was charged with sexual assault of a child after taking a 12 - year old girl and a 15 - year girl as "spiritual wives . "
text_2_html: A Texas jury convicted polygamist sect leader Warren Jeffs of child sexual assault Thursday in a case stemming from two young followers he took as brides in what his church calls "spiritual marriages . "

text_1_html: Some 30 people were killed and 55 others injured , five of them critically , when three artillery shells landed at the perimeter of a school , which usually serves as a girls ' preparatory school , in the Jabaliya refugee camp , according to John Ging , UNRWA 's Director of Operations .
text_2_html: An Israeli mortar strike that killed about 40 Palestinians sheltering in a UN school Tuesday brought new urgency to diplomatic efforts to end Israel 's military onslaught in the Gaza Strip , as the UN Security Council met to discuss the crisis .

text_2_html: An Israeli mortar strike that killed about 40 Palestinians sheltering in a UN school Tuesday brought new urgency to diplomatic efforts to end Israel 's military onslaught in the Gaza Strip , as the UN Security Council met to discuss the crisis .

text_1_html: Industry analysts contacted by eWEEK generally say they believe that Hewlett-Packard 's forthcoming $ 13.9 billion acquisition of Electronic Data Systems ? announced officially on May 13 is a good move for both companies , although there will be the usual integration snafus over vendor neutrality issues , business lines , culture shock and layoffs .
text_2_html: Acquiring EDS also could yield more government work for HP , which had about $ 500 million in prime federal contracts in fiscal 2007 .

text_1_html: Doctors in Gaza said more than 40 people died , including children , in what appears to be the biggest single loss of life of the campaign when Israeli bombs hit al-Fakhora school , in Jabaliya refugee camp , while it was packed with hundreds of people who had fled the fighting .
text_2_html: The bombing has drawn international condemnation , with the EU calling it `` completely unacceptable . ''
text_1: Doctors in Gaza said more than 40 people died , including children , in what appears to be the biggest single loss of life of the campaign when Israeli bombs hit al-Fakhora school , in Jabaliya refugee camp , while it was packed with hundreds of people who had fled the fighting .
prev_text_1: The UN protested at a `` complete absence of accountability '' for the escalating number of civilian deaths in Gaza , saying `` the rule of the gun '' had taken over .
text_2: The bombing has drawn international condemnation , with the EU calling it `` completely unacceptable . ''
prev_text_2: The Israeli attack on the Fakhora school in the northern town of Jabaliya , which also wounded around 100 people , was the deadliest single strike of the offensive so far and the third UN school to come under fire within 24 hours .

text_1_html: The lawsuit , which also alleges a hostile work environment and retaliation , claims the sexist culture at Magic Leap created a " dysfunctional " workplace and is part of the reason the company has yet to actually release a product despite being valued at billions of dollars .
text_2_html: As well as presenting an image of a company where Campbell 's efforts to create a female - friendly workplace and product were coolly received , the suit also alleges more direct tolerance of sexist comments and attitudes .
text_1: The lawsuit, which also alleges a hostile work environment and retaliation, claims the sexist culture at Magic Leap created a "dysfunctional" workplace and is part of the reason the company has yet to actually release a product despite being valued at billions of dollars.
prev_text_1: Campbell says she and other female employees were ignored when giving input on the design of the product and its marketing.
text_2: As well as presenting an image of a company where Campbell's efforts to create a female-friendly workplace and product were coolly received, the suit also alleges more direct tolerance of sexist comments and attitudes.
prev_text_2: None of the proposed changes were made to the design, and later meetings, which were not attended by any of the male members of the team, resulted in "no clear path forward".

text_1_html: Meanwhile , some other highlights from the Census numbers : 27 % of children live in single - parent homes , three times the 9 % who did in 1960 10 % of kids live with a grandparent , 15 % have a stay - at - home mom , 0.6 % have a stay - at - home dad , and 38 % have at least one foreign - born parent 48 % of households are made up of married couples , down from 76 % in 1940 Americans are continuing to marry later , at a median age of 29 for men and 27 for women ; that 's up from 24 and 21 in 1947
text_2_html: Other findings of the survey show a rapidly changing America in which more children are being raised in single - parent homes and more young people are delaying marriage .

text_1_html: She refused to let herself sleep ( she was afraid she 'd freeze to death ) , lost one of her boots along the way , and had to pick up one of her own legs and move it with her hands after she pulled a muscle .
text_2_html: But after walking for miles , she had pulled a muscle near her hip and lost a shoe due to compacted snow .
text_1: She refused to let herself sleep (she was afraid she'd freeze to death), lost one of her boots along the way, and had to pick up one of her own legs and move it with her hands after she pulled a muscle.

text_2_html: The company , a startup best known for securing a valuation in the billions despite never publicly demonstrating its technology , is being sued by Tannen Campbell , its former head of , and later vice - president of , strategic marketing and brand identity .

text_1_html: "Maternal instinct" and a "solutions-oriented" personality are what a 46-year-old Pennsylvania mom says helped her survive a treacherous trek over more than 25 miles of the Grand Canyon to find help for her stranded family, after their car got stuck in a blizzard, Karen Klein tells NBC News.
text_2_html: NEWLINE_CHAR After walking nearly 26 miles , she eventually sought refuge in an empty cabin near the Grand Canyon 's north rim .

text_2: NEWLINE_CHAR After walking nearly 26 miles, she eventually sought refuge in an empty cabin near the Grand Canyon's north rim.
prev_text_2: At daylight, she saw a sign for the Grand Canyon visitor's center and kept hiking through deep snow.

text_1_html: Meanwhile , some other highlights from the Census numbers : 27 % of children live in single - parent homes , three times the 9 % who did in 1960 10 % of kids live with a grandparent , 15 % have a stay - at - home mom , 0.6 % have a stay - at - home dad , and 38 % have at least one foreign - born parent 48 % of households are made up of married couples , down from 76 % in 1940 Americans are continuing to marry later , at a median age of 29 for men and 27 for women ; that 's up from 24 and 21 in 1947
text_2_html: Of the 73.7 million children under 18 in the United States , 27 percent were living in single parent homes last year , tripling the 9 percent in 1960 .

text_1_html: Meanwhile , officials note the DOJ is also re - examining whether there was more to the Clinton email server that had n't been thoroughly wrapped up before that case was closed .
text_2_html: A former senior DOJ official familiar with department leadership 's thinking said officials there are acutely aware of demands from President Donald Trump that they look into Clinton 's use of a private email server while secretary of State - and that they lock up her top aide , Huma Abedin .

text_1_html: Jeffs is charged with two counts of sexual assault for raping two under - aged girls and fathering a child with one of the girls .

text_1: Jeffs is charged with two counts of sexual assault for raping two under - aged girls and fathering a child with one of the girls .

text_1_html: Some said Miers 's nomination might have been doomed as much by White House bungling as conservative activism .
text_2_html: Saddened and surprised , friends and associates of Harrier Miers ' in Texas blamed harsh attacks by the Christian conservatives , along with a bungled White House strategy to sell with her nomination , with sinking the Dallas attorney 's nomination to the nation 's highest court .

text_1_html: The lawsuit filed by Campbell following her firing in December describes a " macho bullying atmosphere , " Business Insider reports .
text_2_html: The lawsuit alleged Campbell was fired because the company 's CEO , Rony Abovitz , refused to acknowledge the misogyny within the company and address a hostile work environment .
text_1: The lawsuit filed by Campbell following her firing in December describes a "macho bullying atmosphere," Business Insider reports.
prev_text_1: When Tannen Campbell was hired by Magic Leap in 2015, the Florida company had no women in leadership roles and its only idea to make its product female-friendly was to release a pink version, according to Forbes.
text_2: The lawsuit alleged Campbell was fired because the company's CEO, Rony Abovitz, refused to acknowledge the misogyny within the company and address a hostile work environment.
prev_text_2: Tannen Campbell, Magic Leap's former vice president of strategic marketing and brand identity, filed the suit in a federal court in the Southern District of Florida.
